case_title: SWP No. 057: Dorothy Faulkner
title: (Recognizance for Dorothy Faulkner and Abigail Faulkner, Jr. by Francis Faulkner & Joseph Marble)
content: SWP No. 57.3(Recognizance for [Dorothy Faulkner] _faulkner_dorothy  and [Abigail Faulkner, Jr.] _faulkner_abigail_jr  by Francis Faulkner & Joseph Marble)[January 13, 1693]Memorandum That on the Thirteenth day of Jan'ry 1692 in the fourth year of the Reigne of our Sovereigne Lord & Lady William & Mary the Grace of God of England &c: King & Queen Defenders of the faith &c: Personally appeared before [William Stoughton] _stoughton_william  Esq'r cheife Justice of their Maj'ies  Province of the Massachusets bay in New England [Francis Falkner] _faulkner_francis  Husbandman & [Joseph Marble Mason] _marble_joseph  both of Andiver in the County of Essex and acknowledged themselves to be joyntly & severally Indebted unto our s'd: sovereigne Lord & Lady & the survivor of them their Heires & Successors in the sum of One Hundred Pounds to be levied on their or either of their Lands and Tenniments, goods & Chattles for the use of our s'd: sovereigne Lord & Lady the King & Queen or survivor of them on Condition that [Dorathy Forkner] _faulkner_dorothy  and Abigaile Forkner haveing stood committed for Suspition of Witchcraft shall make their p'sonall appearance before the Justices of our s'd: Sovereigne Lord & Lady the King & Queen at the next Court of Assizes and Generall Goal Delivery to be holden for the County of Essex then & there to answer to all such matters & things as shall in their Maj'ies behalfe be alleadged against them and to do and receive that which by the s'd: Court shall be then & there injoyned them & thence not to depart without licenceAttest[*Jona Elatson] _elatson_jonathan  Cler.(Reverse) Recog'e;[Francis Falkner] _faulkner_francis [Joseph Marble] _marble_joseph for[Dorathy Falkner] _faulkner_dorothy &[abigaill Faulkner] _faulkner_abigail_jr 10 May Apear'dCleared by proclamation paying fees.( Massachusetts  Archives Collection, Vol. 135 No. 104, Massachusetts State Archives, Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 044a: Daniell Eames
title: (Examination of Daniel Eames )
content: SWP No. 44a.1(Examination of [Daniel Eames] _eames_daniell  )[August 13, 1692 ]13:8:1692the Exam. of [Danll. Emes] _eames_daniell : [Eliz: Johnson] _johnson_elizabeth_jr  owned her confesion against [Danll. Emes] _eames_daniell  & yt he was wth her 3 nights before she owned it & aflicted phelps Child wth popets puting pins in it & she se him Yesterday in the prison. he fell upon [mary lacy] _lacey_mary_sr  & Ell. Johnson & [Richd: Carier] _carrier_richard  said he saw him aflict you. [mary wolcot] _walcott_mary  afirmed [Emes] _eames_daniell  aflicted her last night at aslots [?] house at andiver & she se him aflict [[#[danll Emes]] _eames_daniell , [Tim Swan] _swan_timothy  & Ingalls child [An puttman] _putnam_ann_jr  & [mary warren] _warren_mary  afirme ye [Danll. Emes] _eames_daniell  aflicted them severall times - - - ye aflicted all fell downe wn: he came in Q [Danll. Emes.] _eames_daniell  what doo you act your witch craft before us. tell us how long is it sence you first. Began. ye Evidences say you have be[en] a witch ever since you ran away. A I never went away but wn I went to the southward & stayd a yere & 3 or 4 months. it was in June.about I am 28 yeres old: I have be maried 8 or 9 yeres. I first & formost am arand [arraigned?] [torn] afore ye. honr. I am her before you. in ye presents of Jx [Jesus Christ] yt you would  pray for me yt I may spek ye truth. he yt is ye Gret Judge knows yt I never did ceovnt. wth: ye divel: & doe not know any thing of it I never signed to no book nor never se satan or any of his Instrmnts yt I know of Q her is [mary warren] _warren_mary . yt never saw you personaly, yt afirmes you have aflicted her above a month. Se if you can look upon her: he turned about & 5 fell downe & wth his touch he raised ym --- I did drem I se [Goody tooaker] _toothaker_mary  & some others who did tempt me: to Signe to Sattan but I resisted. Q. are you certain you ware asleep: A. I was asleep. to be sure [Samll Varnum] _varnum_samuel . afirmes yt [#[Danll Emes] _eames_daniell  told Me yt] he yt [Eph. Stevens] _stevens_ephraim . told me yt [Danll Emes] _eames_daniell . said yt he followed ye Divell in ye shap of a horse over 5 mile pond. & Bridges[Richd. Carier] _carrier_richard  afirmed yt. [Danll. Emes] _eames_daniell  shap knock him downe:A. as I was once on aprogrese [Jno. Wilson] _wilson_jno  [Jno Lull.] _lull_jno  was going to Salsbury & I went wth ym: & came againe to gether: [Jno. Lull] _lull_jno . came up along wth me till we came againe @ 5 mile pond. I had ben long from home: & was not willing ye man should goe wth me: home:Bridges: saith: ye report yt. he invited this man & cheated him, told ye man that ther was ye divel in ye 5 mile pond: & said he would goe to him, but he rid away home & shut ye door:ye brook by [Samll. bratlebooks] _bratlebooks_samuel  house. when I was alitle boy: my fathr. left me at home & I got abotle of rum & Drank more yn might doe me good.[mary waren] _warren_mary  afirmed that this [danll. Emes] _eames_daniell  afflicted me wn. falkner was Exam. & ther was a young man apered & ye bl man stood upon his shoulder:[mary post] _post_mary  doe you know DE: yes I know him his is my neighbr. did you ever know him to aflict: no - did you know him to be awitch. no. -- [Goody bridges] _bridges_mary_sr  doe you know him yes doe you know him to be a witch no: -- [An: Putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  said he was made a witch at a brook:at yt time at ye Brook at ingagmt [engagement] did you make to ye divell:: Bridges: I beleve ther is evidence Enough. yt he said the divill caried him & his pack to ye brook. at yt sabath day: I doe not know but I might say so, but I bely my selfe --[Eliz Johnson] _johnson_elizabeth_jr  afirmes yt the young man yt stood before [Emes] _eames_daniell  at ye bl man is [Deane Robinson] _robinson_deane . & [mary lacy] _lacey_mary_sr  said yt young man hurt [mary warren] _warren_mary :: I se him personally. at [ffr deans] _dane_francis_jr  lane & he told me he was awizard & at gate in his shap & a bl cat wth him yt told me yt he was danll. [Emes] _eames_daniell : & said he would goe along  wth me to aflict folkes(Reverse) EJ: the 3 time was ye nite afore I owned he said he apeared in his shap & I wen with him to aflict child & aflicd wth pinching & prickg wth a speare [Emes] _eames_daniell  pricked wth a pin, it is all true:--- post said her compa was Sear. Chandler. toohaker. Carier ffoster: Nurse:[mary lacy] _lacey_mary_sr  said she saw the aperition of [danll. Emes] _eames_daniell . ye day before her father came to done & told her father she doubtes he would be sent for in away:This Examination taken the13th August 1692 before therMajesties of ye peace in Salematest [John Higginson] _higginson_john  Just peace( UNCAT MS, Miscellaneous Manuscripts (1692), Salem Witchcraft Papers, Massachusetts Historical Society, Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 044a: Daniell Eames
title: (Indictment of Daniel Eames, for Afflcting Mary Warren. Returned Ignoramus)
content: SWP No. 44a.2(Indictment of [Daniel Eames] _eames_daniell , for Afflcting [Mary Warren] _warren_mary . Returned Ignoramus)[May 9, 1692 ]Province of ye Massachusetts Annoq RRs & Reginae Gulielmi & Mariae &c Bay in New England. Essex Quinto Annoqe: [Im 1693The Jurors for our Sovereigne Lord & Lady the King and Queen presents that [Daniell Emmes] _eames_daniell  of ------- in the County of Essex aforsd In or about the thirteenth day of August last in the Yeare 1692 aforsd -- and divers other dayes & times as well before as after Certain Detestable Arts Called witchcrafts and Sorceries wickedly Mallishiously and ffeloniously hath used Practised and Exersised at and in the towne of Salem ---in the County of--- Essex aforesd: Upon and against one [Mary Warren] _warren_mary  #[Bradford] of Salem Single Woman -- by which wicked Arts the said [Mary Warren] _warren_mary --the day and year aforsaid and divers other dayes and times as well before as after, was and is Tortured Afflicted Tormented Consumed Pined and wasted. against ye: Peace of our Sovereigne Lord and Lady the King and Queen their Crowne & Dignity and agt: the Lawes in that Case made and Provided/ Wittness [Mary Walcott] _walcott_mary [An Putnam] _putnam_ann_jr (Reverse) [Daniel Emms] _eames_daniell  for Aflicting [Mary Warren] _warren_mary Ignoramus[Abraham Haseltine] _haseltine_abraham  foreman of ye Grand Jury( UNCAT MS, Miscellaneous Manuscripts (1692), Salem Witchcraft Papers, Massachusetts Historical Society, Boston, MA.)

case_title: SWP No. 063: Sarah Good Executed July 19, 1692
title: (Warrant for the Apprehension of Sarah Good, and Officer's Return)
content: SWP No. 63.1(Warrant for the Apprehension of [Sarah Good] _good_sarah , and Officer's Return)[February 29, 1692 ]Salem feb'y the 29th 1691/2 Whereas [Mrs Joseph Hutcheson] _hutchinson_joseph  [Thomas putnam] _putnam_thomas_jr  [Edward putnam] _putnam_edward  and [Thomas preston] _preston_thomas  Yeomen of Salem Village in the County of Essex personally appeared before us, and made Complaint on Behalfe of theire Majests against [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  the wife of [William Good] _good_sarah  of Salem Village aboves'd for suspition of Witchcraft by her Committed, and thereby much Injury donne to [Eliz parris] _parris_elizabeth , [Abigail Williams] _williams_abigail  [Anna putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  and [Elizabeth Hubert] _hubbard_elizabeth  all of Salem Village afores'd Sundry times within this two moneths and Lately also don, at Salem Village Contrary to the peace of our Sover'n L'd and Lady W'm & mary King & Queen of Engld &c -- You are therefore in theire Majesties names hereby required to apprehe'd & bring before us the said [Sarah Good] _good_sarah , to morrow aboute ten of the clock in the forenoon at the house of [L't Nathaniell Ingersalls] _ingersoll_nathaniel  in Salem Village.or as soon as may be then & there to be Examined Relateing to the aboves'd premises and hereof you are not to faile at your perile Dated Salem, febr 29th 1691/2[John Hathorne] _hathorn_john  ] Assists.[Jonathan.Corwin] _corwin_jonathan  ] Assists.To Constable [George Locker] _locker_george (Reverse) I brought the person of [Saragh Good] _good_sarah  thewife of [william Good] _good_william  according to the tenorof the within warrant as is Attest by me 1.March. 1691/2 [*George Locker] _locker_george Constable( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1 no. 4, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archive, MA. ),

case_title: SWP No. 063: Sarah Good Executed July 19, 1692
title: (Examination of Sarah Good, as Recorded  by Ezekiell Chever )
content: SWP No. 63.2(Examination of [Sarah Good] _good_sarah , as Recorded  by [Ezekiell Chever] _cheever_ezekiel  )[February 1692]The examination of [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  before the Worshipfull assts [John Harthon] _hathorn_john  and [Jonathan Curren] _corwin_jonathan   (H.) [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  what evil spirit have you familiarity with (S G) none (H) have you made no contract with the devil, (g) good answered no (H) why doe you hurt these children (g) I doe not hurt them. I scorn it. (H) who doe you imploy then to doe it (g) I imploy no body, (H) what creature do you imploy then, (g) no creature but I am falsely accused (H) why did you go away muttering from mr Parris his house (g) I did not mutter but I thanked him for what he gave my child (H) have you made no contract with the devil (g) no (H) desired the children all of them to look upon her, and see, if this were the person that had hurt them and so they all did looke upon her and said this was one of the persons that did torment them -- presently they were all tormented. (H) [Sarah good] _good_sarah  doe you not see now what you have done why doe you not tell us the truth, why doe you thus torment these poor children (g) I doe not torment them, H who do you imploy then (g) I imploy nobody I scorn it (H) how came they thus tormented, (g) what doe I know you bring others here and now you charge me with it (H) why who was it. (g) I doe not know but it was some you brought into the meeting house with you (H) wee brought you into the meeting house (g) but you brought in two more (H) Who was it then that tormented the children (g) it was osburn (H) what is it that you say when you goe muttering away from persons houses (g) if I must tell I will tell (H) doe tell us then (g) if I must tell I will tell, it is the commandments I may say my commandments I hope (H) what commandment is it (g) if I must tell you I will tell, it is a psalm (H) what psalm (g) after a long time shee muttered over some part of a psalm (H) who doe you serve (g) I serve God (H) what God doe you serve (g) the god that made heaven and earth though shee was not willing to mention the word God her answers were in a very wicked, spitfull manner reflecting and retorting aganst the authority with base and abusive words and many lies shee was taken in.it was here said that her housband had said that he was afraid that shee either was a witch or would be one very quickly the worsh [mr Harthon] _hathorn_john  asked him his reason why he said so of her whether he had ever seen any thing by her he answered no not in this nature but it was her bad carriage to him and indeed said he I may say with tears that shee is an enimy to all good.(Salem Village March the 1t 1691/2( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1 no. 11, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archive, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 063: Sarah Good Executed July 19, 1692
title: (Examination of Sarah Good, Written by Jonathan Corwin )
content: SWP No. 63.4(Examination of [Sarah Good] _good_sarah , Written by [Jonathan Corwin] _corwin_jonathan  )[March 1, 1692]Salem Village March the 1t. 1691/2 [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  the wife of [Wm Good] _good_sarah  of Salem Village Labourer Brought before us:by [George Locker] _locker_george  Constable in Salem, to Answer [Joseph Hutcheson] _hutchinson_joseph  [Thomas putnam] _putnam_thomas_jr  &c of Salem Village yeomen (Complainants on behalfe of theire Majesties) against s'd [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  for suspition of Witchcraft by her Committed and thereby much Injury don to the Bodys of [Elizabeth parris] _parris_elizabeth  [Abigaile Williams] _williams_abigail  [Anna putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  & [Elizabeth Hubert] _hubbard_elizabeth  all of Salem Village afore'd according to theire Complaints as p'r warrants.Dated Salem March 29th, 1691/2[Sarah Good] _good_sarah  upon Examination denyed the matter of fact (viz) that she ever used any witchcraft; or hurt the abovesaid Children or any of them,The above named Children being all present positively accused her of hurting of them Sundry times within this two moneths and also that morneing[Sarah Good] _good_sarah  denyed that she had been:at theire houses in s'd tyme, neere them, or had don them any hurt all the abovesaid children then presente accused her face to face, upon which they ware all dredfully tortred & tormented for a short space of tyme, and the affliction and torters being over they charged s'd [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  againe that she had then soe tortered them, and came to them and.did itt. althow she was personally then keept at a Considerable distance from them [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  being Asked if that she did not then hurt them; who did it, And the children being againe tortered, she looked upon them, And said that it was one of them Wee brought into the house with us, Wee Asked her who it was, shee then Answered and Said it was [Sarah Osburne] _osbourne_sarah , and [Sarah Osburne] _osbourne_sarah  was then under Custody & not in the house; -- And the children being quickley after recovered out of there fitt sayd. that itt was [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  and also [Sarah Osburne] _osbourne_sarah  that then did hurt & torment or aflict them -- althow both of them at the same time at adistance or Remote from them personally; -- their ware also sundry other Questions put to her & Answers given thereunto by her. according as is also given in.per us [John Hathorne] _hathorn_john  Assists.[Jonathan. Corwin] _corwin_jonathan Salem March the 7th: 1691/2[Sarah Good] _good_sarah  [Sarah Osburne] _osbourne_sarah  and [Titiba] _tituba  an Indian Woman all sent to the Goale in Boston according to theire mittimuses then sent: to theire Majests Goale Keeper( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1 no. 14, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archive, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 063: Sarah Good Executed July 19, 1692
title: (Mittimus for Sarah Good and Tituba ; List of Witnesses )
content: SWP No. 63.5(Mittimus for [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  and [Tituba] _tituba  ; List of Witnesses )[May 25, 1692]To the Keeper of theire Majests Goale  in BostonYou are in theire Majests names hereby required, to take into your care and safe Custody the Bodys of [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  the wife of [W'm Good] _good_william  of Salem farmes husbandman and [Titiba] _tituba  an Indian Woman, belonging unto [mr. Samuell parris] _parris_samuel  of Salem Village Minester, who stand Charged on behalfe of theire Majests. for theire feloniously Committing Sundry acts of Witchcraft at Salem Village on the Bodys of [Elizabeth parris] _parris_elizabeth  [Eliz Hubbert] _hubbard_elizabeth  [Abigail Williams] _williams_abigail  And [Ann putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  of Salem Village. whereby great hurt hath beene donne to theire Body contrary to the peace of our Sov'r L'd and Lady W'm & Mary of England &c King & Queen home you are well to secure untill thay shall thence be delivered by due order of Law and hereof you are not to faileDated Boston  May the 25t 1692                                [John Hathorne] _hathorn_john  ] Assists.                                [Jonathan Corwin] _corwin_jonathan  ] Assists (O. R.) Mittimus  ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1 no. 8. Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archive, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 063: Sarah Good Executed July 19, 1692
title: (Examinations of Sarah Good , Sarah Osborne , and Tituba, as Written by Joseph Putnam )
content: SWP No. 63.6(Examinations of [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  , [Sarah Osborne] _osbourne_sarah  , and [Tituba] _tituba , as Written by [Joseph Putnam] _putnam_joseph  )[March 1, 1692 ]Whatt [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  saith1 with non 2 shee saith that shee did doe them noe harme 3 shee implyd noe budey to doe the children 4 shee saith that shee hath made no contract nor covenant 5 shee saith that shee never did hurt the children 6 shee saith that she never had familyarity att the Devell 7 shee saith that shee never saw the children in such a condition shee saith that shee came nott to meting for want of cloase who is itt shee usially discorceseth with nobodey: but itt is a psalme or a comandement: her God is the god that made heaven and earth she hops: she saith that shee never did noe harme to mr parrshe saith itt was nott she itt is gamer osborne that doth pinch and aflicht the children[william good] _good_william  saith thatt shee is anenemy to all good shee saith shee is cleare of being a wichWhat gamer [osborn] _osbourne_sarah  saith --1 shee saith she had noe hand in hurting the children nether by hur self by in strementsshe saith that shee saith that #[shee] was more lickley beewicht then a wichshee said shee would never beeleave the devell, the devell did propound to hur that shee should never goe to meting noe more and att that time nothing was suggested to hur elcesWhy did she pinch the young woaman shee never did nor dont know who didWhat the Indyen woman saith they have don noe harme to hur shee saith she doth nott know how the dveill works -- Who it it that hurts them the devell frot I know there is fowre that hurts the children 2 of the women are gamer [Osburn] _osbourne_sarah  and gamer [Good] _good_sarah  and they say itt is shee one of the women is atall and short women and they would have hur goe with them to boston and shee oned that shee did itt att first butt [butt] she was sorry for itt: itt was the apearance of a man that came to hur and told hur that she must hurt the Children and she said that 4 times shaps or a hodg or adodge and bid her sarve him she said that shee could nott then she said he would hurt hur shee all soe said that Shee seed a yalow burd that said unto hur sarve me and shee seed 2 catts and they said sarve me she murst more pinch the childrenshe saith she sends the catt to bid hur pinch them: and the man brings the maid and bids her pinch hir: and they doe pull hur and make hur goe with them to mr putman to perplex them: and they make hur ride upone apoall and they hould the poll and osband and good all soe rids upon poalls and they the 2 women would have hur cill [thomas putmans] _putnam_thomas_jr  child The 2 women and the man told hur that if she told to hur master they would cutt of hur heed and yester day tetaby abigall sayd that she say athing with wings and 2 leedgs and vanished into the chape of osborn and the indgen oneth the same: and all soe atends osborn a short and hary thing with 2 ledgs and to Whings all soe tetaby oneth that sary good sent a wolfe to scare the dr maid(Reverse) Written by Jos putnam  Salem Village  March the 1t 1691/2 Ag't [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1, no. 9, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archive, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 063: Sarah Good Executed July 19, 1692
title: (Summary of Evidence v. Sarah Good )
content: SWP No. 63.7(Summary of Evidence v. [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  )[++ June 29, 1692 ]Titabes Confession & Examinacon ag't. her selfe & [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  abstractedCharges [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  to hurt the Children & would have had her done it 5. were with her last night & would have.had her hurt the Children w'ch she refused & that [Good] _good_sarah  was one of them[Good] _good_sarah  with others are very strong & pull her with them to [Mr. putnams] _putnam_thomas_jr  & made her hurt the Child. [Good] _good_sarah  [ther] rode with her upon Apoole behind her, takeing hold of one another doth not know how they goe for she never sees trees nor path but are presently th --[Good] _good_sarah  [ther] tell her she must kill some body with a knife & would have had her killed [Tho: putnams] _putnam_thomas_jr  Child last night the Child at the same time afirmed she would have had her cutt of her own head if not [Titabe] _tituba  would doe it & complained of a knife cutting her[Good] _good_sarah  came to her last night when her Mr. was at prayer & would not let her hear hath one yellow bird & stopped her Eares in prayer time, the yellow bird hath been seen by the Children & [Titabee] _tituba  saw it suck [Good] _good_sarah  between the forefinger & long finger upon the right handSaw [Good] _good_sarah  [ther] practice witchcraft.Saw [Good] _good_sarah  have a Catt besides the bird & a thing all over hair [ther][Sarah Good] _good_sarah  appeared like a wolfe to [Hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth  going to [proctors] _proctor_elizabeth  & saw it sent by [Good] _good_sarah  to [Hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth [Good] _good_sarah  [ther] hurt the Children again & the Children affirme the same [Hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth  knew th[em] not being blinded by them & was once or twice taken dumb herslefe i:e: [Titabe] _tituba [Good] _good_sarah  caused her to pinch the Children all in their own personsSaw [Goods] _good_sarah  name in the booke, & the devell told her they made these marks & said to her she made ther marke & it was the same day she went to prison[Good] _good_sarah  [ther] came to ride abroad with her & the man shewed her [Goods] _good_sarah  mark in the book[Good] _good_sarah  [ther] pinched her on the leggs & being searched found it soe after confessionNota [S. G.] _good_sarah  mumbled when she went away from [Mr Parriss] _parris_samuel  & the children after hurt.[Dorothy Goods] _good_dorothy  Charge ag't. her mother [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  . That she had three birds one black, one yellow & that these birds hurt the Children & afflicted persons.her own Confession Nota None here sees the witches but the afflicted & themselves Charges [Sarah Osburne] _osbourne_sarah  with hurting the Children -- looking upon them at the same time & not being afflicted must consequently be a Witch[Deliverance Hobs] _hobbs_deliverance  Confessionbeing at a meeting of the witches in [Mr: parisses] _parris_samuel  feild when [Mr. Burroughs] _burroughs_george  preached & administred the sacram't to them saw [Good] _good_sarah  amongst the rest & this fully agrees with what the afflicted persons relate. 22th. Apr (92)[Abigaile Hobbs'] _hobbs_abigail  Confessionwas in Company with [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  & knowes her to be a witch & afterwards was taken deafe & [Mary walcott] _walcott_mary  [ther] saw [Good] _good_sarah  & osburn run their fingers into this dep'oits ears a little after she spoke & s'd [Good] _good_sarah  told her she sh'd not speake[Mary Warren's] _warren_mary  ConfessionThat [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  is a Witch & brought her the booke to signe to.(Reverse) [Elizabeth Hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth [Mary Walcott] _walcott_mary [Ann puttnam] _putnam_ann_jr [Mercy Lewis] _lewis_mercy [Sarah Vibber] _bibber_sara [Abigail Williams] _williams_abigail aflicted by [S. case_title: SWP No. 063: Sarah Good Executed July 19, 1692
title: (Deposition of Samuel Abbey and Mary Abbey v. Sarah Good )
content: SWP No. 63.13(Deposition of [Samuel Abbey] _abbey_samuel  and [Mary Abbey] _abbey_mary  v. [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  )[+ June 29, 1692 ][Samuel Abbey] _abbey_samuel  of Salem Villiage Aged 45. Years or thereabouts and [Mary Abbey] _abbey_mary  his wife aged 38 years or thereabouts, Deposeth and Saith: That about this Time three Years past [W'm: Good] _good_sarah  and his wife [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  being destitute of an house to dwell in these Deponents out of Charity, they being Poor. lett them live in theirs some time, untill that the said [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  was #[of] so Turbulant a Spirritt, [Spirritt,] Spitefull and so Mallitiously bent, that these Deponents could not suffer her to Live in their howse any Longer; and was forced for Quiettness sake to turne she the said [Sarah] _good_sarah  , with her husband, out of their howse, ever since, which is about two years 1/2 agone; the said [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  , #[--------] hath carried it very Spitefully & Mallitiously, towards them, the winter following after the said [Sarah] _good_sarah  was gone from our house, we began to Loose Cattle, and Lost severall after an unusall Manner, in drupeing Condition and yett they would Eate: and your Deponents have Lost after that manner 17 head of Cattle within two years, besides Sheep, and Hoggs: and both doe beleive they Dyed by witchcraft, the said [William good] _good_william  on the last of may, was twelve months, went home to his wife the s'd [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  , and told her, what a sad-Accident had fallen out, she asked what, he answered that his neighbour Abbey had lost two Cowes, both dyeing within halfe an hour of one another; the s'd [Sarah good] _good_sarah  said she did not care if he the said [Abbey] _abbey_samuel  had Lost all the Cattle he had, as the said [Jno. Good] _good_jonathan  told us. Just that very Day, that said [Sarah good] _good_sarah  was taken up, we yor Deponents had a Cow that could not rise alone, but since presently after she was taken up, the said Cow was well and could rise so well, as if she had ailed nothing: she the said [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  : ever since these Deponants turned her out of their howse she  hath #[carried] behaveed her selfe very crossely & Mallitiously, to them & their Children calling their Children vile Names and hath- threetened them often./.   Jurat in Curia.  (Reverse) [Sam.Abbey] _abbey_samuel  [& wife] _abbey_mary Sworne [Sarah Good] _good_sarah ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem Witchcraft,  vol. 1, no. 18, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archive, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 063: Sarah Good Executed July 19, 1692
title: ( Deposition of Sarah Gadge v. Sarah Good and Thomas Gadge)
content: SWP No. 63.14( Deposition of [Sarah Gadge] _gage_sarah  v. [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  and [Thomas Gadge] _gage_thomas )[June 28, 1692 ]The deposition of [Sarah Gadge] _gage_sarah  the wife of [Thomas Gadge] _gage_thomas  aged about 40 years this deponent testifieth and saith that about two years & an halfe agone; [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  Came to her house & would have come into the house, but s'd. [Sarah Gadge] _gage_sarah  told her she should not come in for she was afraid she had been with them that had the Smallpox: & with that she fell to mutring & scolding extreamly & soe: told s'd [Gadge] _gage_sarah  if she would not let her in she should give her something; & she answered she would not have any thing to doe with her & the next morning after to s'd Deponents best remembrance one of s'd [Gadges] _gage_thomas  Cowes Died in A Sudden, terible & Strange, unusuall maner soe that some of the neighbors & said Deponent did think it to be done by witchcraft & farther saith not ------And [Thomas Gadge] _gage_thomas  husband of s'd [Sarah:] _gage_sarah  testifieth that he had a Cow soe Died about the time abovementioned & though he & some neighbors opened the Cow yet they Could find no naturall Cause of s'd Cowes Death & farther saith not[Thomas gadge] _gage_thomas  and [sarah gadge] _gage_sarah  owned this to be the truth on theire oath. before us; the Juriars for Inquest this 28. of June: 92(Reverse) [Thomas Gauge] _gage_thomas  & his [wife] _gage_sarah  ver. content: SWP No. 63.16(Deposition of [Joseph Herrick, Sr.] _herrick_joseph_sr  , and [Mary Herrick] _herrick_mary  v. [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  )[June 28, 1692 ]The Deposistion of [Joseph Herrick senr.] _herrick_joseph_sr  who testifieth and saith that on the first day of March 1691/2: I being then Constable for Salem: there was delivered to me by warrant from the worshipfull [Jno. Hathorne] _hathorn_john  and [Jonathan Corwin] _corwin_jonathan  Esqrs. [Sarah good] _good_sarah  for me to cary to their majesties Gaol at Ipswich and that night I sett a gard to watch her at my own house namely [Samu'l: Braybrook] _braybrook_samuel  michaell dunell [Jonathan Baker] _baker_jonathan .. and the affore named parsons Informed me in the morning that that night [Sarah good] _good_sarah  was gon for some time from them both bare foot and bare legde: and I was also Informed that: that night [Elizabeth Hubburd] _hubbard_elizabeth  one of the Afflected parsons Complaned that [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  came and afflected hir:being bare foot and bare ledged and Samuell Sibley  that was one that was attending of [Eliza Hubburd] _hubbard_elizabeth  strock [good] _good_sarah  on the Arme as [Elizabeth Hubburd] _hubbard_elizabeth  said and [Mary Herrick] _herrick_mary  and wife of the abovesaid [Joseph Herick] _herrick_joseph_sr  testifieth that on: the 2th: March 1691/2 in the morning I took notis of [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  in the morning and one of hir Armes was Blooddy from a little below the Elbow to the wrist: and I also took notis of her armes on the night before and then there was no signe of blood on them[Joseph herrik senr] _herrick_joseph_sr  and [mary herrik] _herrick_mary  appearid before us the Jury for Inquest: and did on the oath which the had taken owne this their evidense to be the truth; the 28: of June 1692    Sworne in Court (Reverse)  Joseph Herrick and his wife against Sarah GoodMemento.[Sam. content: SWP No. 63.17( Testimony of [William Batten] _batten_william  and [William Shaw] _shaw_william  v. [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  and [Lydia Dustin] _dustin_lydia  )[June 28, 1692 ]The testimony of [William Batten] _batten_william  aged 76 years or their abouts and [william shaw] _shaw_william  aged about 50 years and [Deborah] _shaw_deborah  his wife aged about 40 years, these all testifie and say that this day was a weeke agoe. [Susannah shelding] _sheldon_susannah  being at the house of [william shaw] _shaw_william  shee was  tied her hands a cross in such a manner we were forced to cut the string before we could git her hand loose and when shee was out of her fit she told us it [was] Goode dastin that did tye her hands after that manner, and 4 times shee hath been tyed in this manner in towe weeks time the 2 first times shee sayth it was goode dastin and the 2 last times it was [Sarah Goode] _good_sarah  that did tye her, we furder testifie that when ever shee doeth but touch this string shee is presently bit.We furder testifie that in this time there was a broome carried a way out of the house in visibble to us and put in a apple tree two times and a shirt once and a milke tube once was carried out of the house three poles from the house into the woods and she #[testifieth that] sayeth that it thes parsons above named upon their oath ownid this their tistimony to be the truth before us the Juriars forInqwest this. 28. of June: 1692                           Jurat in Curia  (Reverse) [W'm. title: (Testimony of William Allen, John Hughes , William Good, and Samuel Braybrook v. Sarah Good, Sarah Osborne, and Tituba)
content: SWP No. 63.18(Testimony of [William Allen] _allen_william_of_salem , [John Hughes] _hughes_john  , [William Good] _good_william , and [Samuel Braybrook] _braybrook_samuel  v. [Sarah Good] _good_sarah , [Sarah Osborne] _osbourne_sarah , and [Tituba] _tituba )[March 5, 1692 ]March 5'th 1691/2 [Wm Allin] _allen_william_of_salem  saith that on the 1'st of March att night he heard a strange noyse not useually heard, and so continued for many times so that hee was afrighted and coming nearer to it he there saw a strange and unuseall beast lyeing on the Grownd so that goeing up to it the s'd Beast vanished away and in the s'd place strate up 2 or 3 weemen and flew from mee not after the manner of other weemen but swiftly vanished away out of our sight which weemen wee took to bee [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  [Sarah Osburne] _osbourne_sarah  and [Tittabe] _tituba  the time was a bout an hour within night and I [John Hughes] _hughes_john  saith the same beeing in Company then w'th s'd allin. as wittness our hands[william Allen] _allen_william_of_salem       [john hughes] _hughes_john [William Allen] _allen_william_of_salem  further saith that on the 2'd day of march the s'd [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  vissabley appeared to him in his chamber s'd [allen] _allen_william_of_salem  beeing in bed and brought an unuseuall light in w'th her the s'd [Sarah] _osbourne_sarah  came and sate upon his foot the s'd [allen] _allen_william_of_salem  went to kick att her upon which shee vanished and the light with her[william Good] _good_william  saith that the night before his s'd wife was Examined he saw a wart or tett a little belowe her Right shoulder which he never saw before and asked [Goodwife Engersol] _ingersoll_sarah  whether she did not see it when shee searched her[John Hughes.] _hughes_john  further saith that on the 2'd day of march that comeing from [Goodman Sibleys] _sibley_samuel  a boute Eight of the clock in the night hee saw a Great white dogg whome he came up to but he would not stire but when He was past hee the s'd dogg followed him about 4 or 5 pole and so disapeared the same night the s'd [John Hughes] _hughes_john  beeing in Bed in a clossd Roome and the dore being fast so that no catt nor dogg could come in the said [John] _hughes_john  saw a Great light appeare in the s'd Chamber and Risseing up in his bed he saw a large Grey Catt att his beds footMarch the 2'd Sam'l Brabrook saith that Carrieng [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  to ippswich the said [Sarah] _good_sarah  leapt of her horse 3 times which was Between 12 and 3 of the clock of the same day w'ch the daughter of [Thomas Puttman] _putnam_thomas_jr  declared the same att her fathers house the s'd Brabrook further saith that s'd [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  tould him that shee would not owne her selfe to bee a wicth unless she is provd one shee saith that there is but one Evidence and thats and Indian and therefore she fears not and so Continued Rayling against the Majestrates and she Endevered to kill herselfe(Reverse) Allin &c ag't Sarah Good( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1, no. 29, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, content: SWP No. 63.21(Deposition of [Susannah Sheldon] _sheldon_susannah  v. [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  )[June 28, 1692 ]The Deposition of [Susannah Shelden] _sheldon_susannah  agged about 18 years who testifieth and saith that sence I have ben afflected I have very often ben most greviously tortored by Apperishtion of [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  who has most dredfully afflected me by bitting pricking and pinching me and almost choaking me to death but on the 26. June 1692 [Sarah good] _good_sarah  most violently pulled down my head behind a Cheast and tyed my hands together with a whele band & allmost Choaked me to death and also severall times sence the Apperishtion of [Sarah good] _good_sarah  has most greviously tortored me by biting pinching and almost Choaking me to death: also [william Battin] _batten_william  and [Thomas Buffington Juner] _buffington_thomas_jr  ware forced to cutt the whele band from ofe my hands for they could not unty itAnd farther s'd [Sheldon] _sheldon_susannah  upon giving in this testimony to the grand jury was seized with sundry fits w'ch. when she came to her self she told the s'd jury being aske that it was s'd. [Good] _good_sarah  that afflicted her & a little after [Mary Warren] _warren_mary  falling into a fit s'd. [Sheldon] _sheldon_susannah  affirmed to the Grand jury that she saw s'd Good upon her, & also a sauser being by invisible hands taken of from a Table & carried out of doors s'd. [Sheldon] _sheldon_susannah  affirmed she saw said [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  carry it away & put it where it was found abroad.[Susanah Shelden:] _sheldon_susannah  oned this har testimony to be the truth beforethe Juriars of Inquest on the oath which she had takenthis. 28. of June 1692.(Reverse) [Susannah Sheldon] _sheldon_susannah  Ag't[Sarah Good] _good_sarah ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1 no. 23, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archive, MA. )

[Sarah Good] _good_sarah  )[++ June 28, 1692 ]The deposition of [Johanna Childun] _childin_johanna  testifieth and saieth that upon 2d: of June: 1692: that the aparition of [Sarah good] _good_sarah  and her least Child did apear to her: and the Child did tell its mother that she did murrder it: to which [Sarah good] _good_sarah  replyed that she did it becaus that she Could not atend it and the Child tould its mother that she was A witch: and then [Sarah good] _good_sarah  said she did give it to the divell( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1 no. 22, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archive, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 063: Sarah Good Executed July 19, 1692
title: (Deposition of Henry Herrick and Jonathan Batchelor v. Sarah Good )
content: SWP No. 63.23(Deposition of [Henry Herrick] _herrick_henry  and [Jonathan Batchelor] _batchelor_jonathan  v. [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  )[+ June 29, 1692 ]The deposition of [Henery Herrick] _herrick_henry  aged About 21 one years, this deponent testifieth & saith that in Last march was two yeare; [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  came to his fathers house & desired to lodge there; & his father forbid it; & she went away Grumbling & my father bid us follow her & see that shee went away clear, lest she should lie in the barn: & by smoking of her pipe should fire the barn; & s'd deponent with [Jonathan Batchelor] _batchelor_jonathan  seing her make a stop near the barne bid her be gone; or he would set her father of; to which she replied that then it should cost his father [Zachariah Herick] _herrick_zachariah  one; or two of the best Cowes which he had; --And [Jonathan Batchelor] _batchelor_jonathan  aged 14 year testifieth the same abovewritten; and doth farther testifie that about a weeke after two of his grandfathers: Master Catle were removed from their places: & other younger Catle put in their rooms & since that severall of their Catle have bene set Loose in a strange maner --              Jurat in Curia  (Reverse) [H. Herrick] _herrick_henry  [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1 no. 21, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archive, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 063: Sarah Good Executed July 19, 1692
title: (Deposition of Sarah Bibber v. Sarah Good )
content: SWP No. 63.24(Deposition of [Sarah Bibber] _bibber_sara  v. [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  )[June 28, 1692 ]The Deposistion of [Sarah viber] _bibber_sara  aged about 36 years who testifieth and saith that sence I have been afflected I have often seen the  Apperishtion of [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  but she did not hurt me tell the 2 day of May 1692 tho I saw hir Apperishtion most greviously tortor [mercy lewes] _lewis_mercy  & [Jno. Indian] _indian_john  att Salem. on the 11th April 1692: but on the 2: may 1692 the Apperishtion of [Sarah good] _good_sarah  did most greviously torment me by presing my breath almost out of my body and also she did immediately afflect my child by pinceing of it that I could hardly hold it and my husband seing of it took hold of the Child but it cried out and twisted so dreadfully by reson of the torture that the Apperishtion of [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  did afflect it with all that it gott out of its fathers Armes to:also several[ly] times sence the Apperishtion of [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  has most greviously tormented me by beating and pinching me and almost Choaking me to death and pricking me with pinnes after a most dreadfull maner[Sarah viber] _bibber_sara  ownid this har tistimony to be the truth one the oath she had taken: be fore us the Juriars for Inquest: this: 28 dy of June 1692 Sworne. in Court June 29th. 1692. And further Adds. that shee very beleives uppon her Oath that [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  had bewicthed her --(Reverse)[Sarah viber] _bibber_sara  against [Sarah good] _good_sarah  June 29, 1692( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 1 no. 26, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archive, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 063: Sarah Good Executed July 19, 1692
title: (Warrant for the Execution of Sarah Good , Rebecca Nurse, Susannah Martin , Elizabeth How , and Sarah Wilds )
content: SWP No. 63.28(Warrant for the Execution of [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  , [Rebecca Nurse] _nurse_rebecca , [Susannah Martin] _martin_susannah  , [Elizabeth How] _how_elizabeth  , and [Sarah Wilds] _wilds_sarah  )[July 19, 1692 ]To [Georg: Corwine] _corwine_george  Gent'n High Sheriff of the County of Essex GreetingWhereas [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  Wife of [William Good] _good_william  of Salem Village [Rebecka Nurse] _nurse_rebecca  wife of [Francis Nurse] _nurse_francis  of Salem Villiage [Susanna Martin] _martin_susannah  of Amesbury Widow [Elizabeth How] _how_elizabeth  wife of [James How] _how_james_jr  of Ipswich [Sarah Wild] _wilds_sarah  Wife of [John Wild] _wilds_john  of Topsfield all of the County of Essex in their Maj'ts Province of the Massachusetts Bay in New England Att A Court of Oyer & Terminer held by Adjournment for Our Soveraign Lord & Lady King William & Queen Mary for the said County of Essex at Salem in the s'd County on the 29th day of June [past] were Severaly arraigned on Several Indictments for the horrible Crime of Witchcraft by them practised & Committed On Severall persons and pleading not guilty did for their Tryall put themselves on God & Thier Countrey whereupon they were Each of them found & brought in Guilty by the Jury that passed On them according to their respective Indictm[ents] and Sentence of death did then pass upon them as the Law directs Execution whereof yet remains to be done:Those are Therefore in thier Maj'ties name William & Mary now King & Queen over England &ca: to will & Comand you that upon Tuesday next being the 19th day of [torn] Instant July between the houres of Eight & [torn] in [torn] forenoon the same day you  Safely conduct the sd [Sarah [Good] _good_sarah  [Rebecca Nurse] _nurse_rebecca  [Susanna Martin] _martin_susannah  [Elizabeth How] _how_elizabeth  & [Sarah Wild] _wilds_sarah  From their Maj'ties Goal in Salem afores'd to place of Execution & there Cause them & Every of them to be hanged by the Neck untill they be dead and of the doings herein make return to the Clerke of the said Court & this precept and hereof you are not to fail at your perill and this Shall be your Sufficient Warrant Given under my hand & seale at Boston the 12'th day of July in the fourth year of the Reign of our Soveraigne Lord & Lady Wm & Mary King and Queen &ca: Annoq Dom. 1692 --           [*Wm Stoughton] _stoughton_william (Reverse)  Salem July 19th 1692  I caused the within mentioned persons to be Executed according to the Tenour of the with[in] warrant                                           [*George Corwin] _corwine_george  Sherif ( MS Am 48, Rare Books & Manuscripts, Boston Public Library, Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 032: Rachel Clinton
title: (Warrant for the apprehension of Rachel Clinton, and Summons for Witnesses v. Rachel Clinton, and Officer’s Return )
content: SWP No. 32.1(Warrant for the apprehension of [Rachel Clinton] _clenton_rachel , and Summons for Witnesses v. Rachel Clinton, and Officer’s Return )[March 29, 1692]To the Constable of Ipswich -- Whereas There is Complaint Exhibbitted to the Honored Court now  holden at Ipswich -- In Behalfe of their majesties. against [Rachell] _clenton_rachel  -- Formerly the Wife of  [Lawrence Clenton] _clenton_lawrence  of Ipswich on grounded Suspision of witchcraft, & whereas Recognizance is Enterd, for prosecution --You are hereby Required in their Majesties names forthwith or as  soon as may be to apprehend seize & bringe before the Honored  Court to be holden at Ipswich the sayd [Rachell Clenton] _clenton_rachel  on the next  morrow morning at Eight a Clock In order to an orderly Examination, & Conviction & hereof fail not at Your perrill & for so doing this shall be your warrant of which you are to make a true returne  as the Law derects:                                                        P[er] Curiam [*Tho's Wade] _wade_thomas  Cler                                                         Ipswich  March 29'th 1692)  To the Constable of IpswichYou are hereby required In their Majesties names to Sumons warne  & Require to appeare at the Court to be holden at Ipswich on the  morrow morning Viz't [Mary Fuller sen'r] _fuller_mary_sr  & [Mary fuller Junior] _fuller_mary_jr   & [Allexsander Thomson jur] _thomson_alexander_jr  & [Richard fitts] _fitts_richard  & [Doct: John Bridgham] _bridgham_doc_john   & [Thomas Maning] _manning_thomas  & [Nathaniel Burnam] _burnam_nathaniel  all of Ipswich & [Thomas Knowlton jur] _knowlton_thomas_jr  & [Mary Thorne] _thorne_mary  To Give in their severall Evidences before the Court to Cleare up the Grounds of Suspition of [Rachell Clenton] _clenton_rachel  Being a Witch & hereof faile not at Your perrill but make  a true returne under Your hand as the Law Directs --P[er]. Curiam [*Thos Wade] _wade_thomas  Cler.(Reverse) I have served this warrant and read it to [Rechell Clinton:] _clenton_rachel  this morning : and sezed hur Body: and Left hur in the hands of [Samuell Ordeway:] _ordway_samuel  [to] have in the Court house Against your honoures shall  Call for hur and I have Red the severeall warrants one the other  sid written this morning save only [Richard fitts] _fitts_richard  and [Mary Thorne] _thorne_mary  and [Richard fitts] _fitts_richard  I could not find and [Mary Thorne] _thorne_mary  is not well:as witness my hand [*Joseph Fuller] _fuller_joseph  ,  Constable ofIpswich: Dated this 29'th March 1692  ( Suffolk Court Files, vol. 31, docket 2660, p. 140. Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archives. Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 032: Rachel Clinton
title: (Summons for Witnesses to the Examination of Rachel Clinton, and Officer's Return )
content: SWP No. 32.2(Summons for Witnesses to the Examination of [Rachel Clinton] _clenton_rachel , and Officer's Return )[April 21, 1692 ]To Sarje't [John Choate] _choate_john , sen'r. To [Jonas Gregory] _gregory_jonas , To [James Burnam] _burnam_james , all of Ipswich, [Mary Andrews] _andrews_mary , [Sarah Rogors] _rogors_sarah , [Marguriet Lord] _lord_margaret , [Sary Halwell] _halwell_sary  you & each of you are hereby Required in thair majesties names To make Your personall apperance before ye Worshipfull Maj'r [Sam'll Appleton] _appleton_samuel  Esq., & ye Clerk of ye Court to be at ye house of Mr. [John Spark] _spark_john  in Ipswich on ye 22d Day of This Instant aprile, at two o'clock afternoon. Then and There to Give in Your severall respective Evidences in behalf of their majesties concerning wch Clearing up of ye grounds of Suspission of [Rachell Clentons] _clenton_rachel  being a witch, who is Then and Thair to be upon further Examination. Therefore So make Your apperance according to this Sumons fail nott at your perril.Ipswich,  Dated aprill 21st, 1692                    Curiam [Tho's Wade] _wade_thomas , Clerk.  Ye Constable of Ipswich is alike Required to Give notis to ye said person, & to make returne as ye Law Directs. Curr [T. W.] _wade_thomas  Clk.According to this within written I haue Sumonsed and warned them: to Apere According to Time & Place by me [William Baker] _baker_william , Constable.    Dated this 22d of april, 1692.(Thomas Franklin Waters, Ipswich in the Massachusetts Bay Colony (Ipswich, MA: Ipswich Historical Society, 1905): 461.)

case_title: SWP No. 032: Rachel Clinton
title: ( Deposition of Mary Fuller, Sr. , v. Rachel Clenton )
content: SWP No. 32.3( Deposition of [Mary Fuller, Sr.] _fuller_mary_sr  , v. [Rachel Clenton] _clenton_rachel  )[+ March 30, 1692]The Deposition of [Mary fuller sen'or] _fuller_mary_sr  Aged About 41 years Saieth  About the 23 or fouorth of Last March: 1691/2 About Tenn of the Clock [Rachell Clenton] _clenton_rachel  cam to our house and Charged me with  Raisen Lies of hur About my Daughter and [Mary Thorne] _thorne_mary  and whille she S'd [Rachell] _clenton_rachel  was drawing: my Brother [Joseph Fuller's] _fuller_joseph  boy Com in  and said their Betty was fall Downe Ded and this was as shee S'd  [Rechell] _clenton_rachel  pased by: hur: A comming to our house and further Run up  to my Brothers [Joseph Fullers] _fuller_joseph  house for the space of Three hours  with out any motission [motion] of Life. and before sd Betty or Elizabeth: Huching: Could  #[I speke Deponent testifief] spake I Get hur hold up hur hand  If S'd [Rachell] _clenton_rachel  was the Caus of it and shee Ded: and when shee Could Speke shee s'd The wommon with A whit Cape pased by and  struck hur: on the forehead:( Suffolk Court Files, vol. 31, docket 2660, p. 140. Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archives. Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 032: Rachel Clinton
title: ( Deposition of Thomas Knowlton Jr. v. Rachel Clinton
content: SWP No. 32.4( Deposition of [Thomas Knowlton Jr.] _knowlton_thomas_jr  v. [Rachel Clinton] _clenton_rachel.html )[+ March 30, 1692]The Deposition of thomas Knoulton aged: 50 years saith that About3 wekes agoo that [Mr John Rogers] rogers_john  and his wife were Gon to Bosto[n]That Rechell ye wife of Laron Clinton: that is now surspected to be A wich; went to MRogers house and told m Rogers maid that she must haue sum meet and milk: & the sd Rechellwent into seueiell Rumes of the sd house: as m Rogerses maid told me; andthen sent for me this Diponant: to Geet hur away out of the hous and when ICame into the house: ther was [Rechell Clinton] _clenton_rachel  and whennshee sawe me Cum inshee the sd Rachell went away: skoldi[ng] and Railing. Calling of me the sdThomas: hell howne: and whoremasterle Roog: and sd I was A Lim[b] of the Deuell:and shee sai[d] shee had Reither see the Deuill then see me the said Thomas:and that [samuel Aires:] _ayers_samuel  and [Thomas smith] (smith_thomas  Tailer Can testifie to the same Langues that Rachell used or Cald the said Knolten: and after this the said Rachell took up a stone and Thrue it Towards me and it fell short three or four yeards of from me sd Knolten, an[d]so Came Roling to me: and Gust Touched the Too of my sho[e]  Andpresently my Grat Too was in at A Gret Reage as if the nail e  were hald up by a peir ofpinchers: up by the Roots: a  and further the said [Thomas Knolton] knowlton_thomas_jr  Testifieth and saith: that About 3 months Agoo: that my Daughter mary Ded[?]: and Cried out in a  Dredfullmannor that shee was p[ricked?] of hur sid: with pins as shee thought: Beingasked whoe prick hur: shee sd shee Could not teell: and when shee wasout of hur fitts I this Deponant asked hur; whether shee Gaue Rech[el] any pines:and shee said shee Gave Rachell: About seuen: & aftor this shee had one fitt mor of April 4, 1692Being prickt: and then Ther Came in to our house Curnilius Kentand [John Best] (best_john , an[d] saw [mary Knolton] knowlton_mary  in a solom Condition: Crying as if shee would be prickt to Dearth: and then said Kent and Best and my son Thomas went over and Threthen sd Rachell: That if Ever shee prickt sd [mary Knolton] (knolton_mary  againe thay would Knock out hur Brains: and Ever sence: my Gerill hath bin well:  ( MS, Witchcraft Collection, no. 4620, Box 3, Folder 19. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library. )

case_title: SWP No. 032: Rachel Clinton
title: ( Deposition of Thomas Boarman v. Rachel Clenton )
content: SWP No. 32.5( Deposition of [Thomas Boarman] _boarman_thomas  v. [Rachel Clenton] _clenton_rachel  )[++ April 4, 1692 ]This Deposition of [Thomas Boarman] _boarman_thomas  sen'or aged 47 This Deponent testifieth and saith that som wimen of worth and quality: Desired  me To Aquaint the seven men that [Rachell Clinton] _clenton_rachel  was a great Dissturber unto them in the meten house in hunching them with hur Elboo: as they went by hur s'd [Clinton] _clenton_rachel , and then the same Day ther I the  s'd [Boarman] _boarman_thomas  : Desired the seven men to take som Cear the [Rachell Clenton] _clenton_rachel  : might be forewarned: not to com in to Thoes wimens house,  no more to Dissturbe them, and as I the s'd [Boarman] _boarman_thomas  was Riding  whom: that night after I had bin with the select men: I saw somthing appere at frenches Coue, Before me Like a  Cat as I Apperprehended: and then I looked wishfully upon it; and it Semed to be  sumething Like a Littell Doge: and then I pursued it: and it Kept  the same Distance in the parth before me: all though I Road hoard  after it I could not over take it, then I looked once [to] my right  hand: and I saw a Grat surkle [= circle?]that moved as fast as I Roud along:  and Then I thought of [Rachell Clinton] _clenton_rachel  then the Littell Creatur andthe surkle vanished away: and further saith not.( Suffolk Court Files, vol. 31, docket 2660, p. 140. Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archives. Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 032: Rachel Clinton
title: ( Deposition William Baker v. Rachel Clenton )
content: SWP No. 32.6( Deposition [William Baker] _baker_william  v. [Rachel Clenton] _clenton_rachel  )[++ April 4, 1692 ]The Deposion of [William Baker] _baker_william  Aged 36 years Saith: About 10 years  Agoo: I living with my Master Rust: There was a Barrill of strong beer brewed & the Day it was Brewed [Rachell Clinton] _clenton_rachel  came there,  & was with sum small Thing:  But what it was I can not tell: & the Day  morning the Bere was put in to the Berrill: & that day said [Rachell] _clenton_rachel  went bakwords and forrowords, 6 or 7 times: up & Dow the lane  that Leds to our house & Did not com in to the house that Day:  & that night following: [hannah Rust:] _rust_hanneh  went Downe to see whether the Bere worked or no: & Puld out the tape & could find no Bere in  the Barrel: neither was there any appearance of wet upon the flouer:  and presently aftor we fild the Barril with worter and it was in A  night and Day and Ded not Leke any of it out as we could see And after that we our folke Brued another Barrel of Bere and put it in  the sam Barrill & it Did not Leke at all aftor that And further Saieth not:( Suffolk Court Files, vol. 31 Docket No. 2660, p. 140, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archives. Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 032: Rachel Clinton
title: ( Testimony of Mary Edwards v. Rachel Clenton )
content: SWP No. 32.7( Testimony of [Mary Edwards] _edwards_mary  v. [Rachel Clenton] _clenton_rachel  )[April 4, 1692 ]Ipswich April the 4'th 1692 The testimony of [Mary Edwards] edwards_mary  ageed about 52 yeres testifieth  & Saith that abought the 27'th day: of: this Last Dissember 1691 that [Rachell CLenton] _clenton_rachel  came to our houes & was very importinat with me  the s'd [Mary:] _edwards_mary  to have Rome in our house to kepe share but I tould: har the s'd [Rachell] _clenton_rachel  that there were no wages: provided to acommedat har tharfore she -- must Rest har seat contented:)& at: this time: I  the s'd [Mary] _edwards_mary  was mackeing of BLood pudens: and she the above  s'd [Rachell] _clenton_rachel  siting by the fier) by: her discorse had a great dissire to  have sum of that pudens: saying that it was very good foode:  & that she loved it very: well: so I the s'd [mary] _edwards_mary  gave: her: the s'd  [Rachell] _clenton_rachel  one of the pudens: the which she Reseaved vary: Cornfully:  & quickly after rose up: out of her seate & went a way: muttering  but what she said I coulld not tell: but about the Latter end of Jinnywary: the s'd [Edwards] _edwards_mary  : had nine pigges: that ware a bout eight weckes oulld that ware: tacken suddenly: five of them: &: died  & a bout a fortnight after that the s'd [Edwards] _edwards_mary : had thre: yerelings tacken sudently that semed to be very harty: & was: in good: Case: but sudenly was tacken with unusuall fittes: Jumping & Roreing till thay tumbled downe with in a Littell tim after one another) as: to: the Latter part of this testymony Releating to the death of my pigges:  & yearings I can attest two                                      [John s edwards, sen'r] _edwards_john_sr  his //_/   mark::  & furthermore [mary: edwards:] _edwards_mary  heard sum of her Children aske the s'd  [Reachell] _clenton_rachel  how har hands ceame so: be Scracht: & swelled so & she: made: This answar & said that she: had two or thre: Roges: catts: that when she put downe her hand would scratch it: ( MS Ch K 1.40, vol. 2, p. 60, Dept. of Rare Books and Manuscripts, Boston Publiv Library, Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 032: Rachel Clinton
title: ( James Fuller, Jr. v. Rachel Clenton )
content: SWP No. 32.8( [James Fuller, Jr.] _fuller_james_jr  v. [Rachel Clenton] _clenton_rachel  )[++ April 4, 1692 ]The deposition of [Jeams Fuller Junier] _fuller_james_jr  aged about eighteen years  saith that on the 15'th Day of march Last: 1692 or there a bouts:  as to the Day: A bout 9 or 10: of the Clock: I was talking with [Goodman Perry] _perry_goodman  & telling him how the s'd [mary Fuller] _fuller_mary_jr  my sister & [Mary Thorn] _thorne_mary  wer taken last night: & in the mene while, whilst he and I was talking [Rachell Clinton] _clenton_rachel  Cam in to our house & sat Downe by the fier  I asked hur what shee came bother for at this time of night, & shee  said shee Came to see what Lies them were that we raisd of hur  & I tould hur I Ded not know as I had Raisd Eny of hur: Presently  my onkles Boy Cam in & told me that ther Betty was Ded, and as  soon as Ever she s'd [Rachall] _clenton_rachel  Herd them words: she run out of Dors:  and I followed hur as herd as I could & when I Came to the Dore I could see nothing of hur: & it was a very Cler mone light night & I  Run up to my onkles: [Joseph fullers] _fuller_joseph  House: to see what the matter  was: & ther I found the Gerle Dede as the boys told me; & s'd onkl  fuller & I took hur up & Cerried hur in the house & so shee continued for the space of 3 or 4 hours: before ther was any Apperance  of Life in hur; & the next Day I asked hur whot mad hur so Last  night & she told me: She See Sumthing stare up at the Corner of the shope & Shee went a little way towards it & it Loced So Basly she turned About to Run a way from it & it followed her & Knocked  hur Down( MS Ch K 1.40, vol. 2, p. 68,  Dept. of Rare Books and Manuscripts, Boston Public Library, Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 032: Rachel Clinton
title: (Deposition of Thomas Burnam Jr. v. Rachel Clinton)
content: SWP No. 32.9(Deposition of [Thomas Burnam Jr.] _burnam_thomas  v. [Rachel Clinton] _clenton_rachel )[+ March 30, 1692 ]The Depsition of [Thomas Burnam] _burnam_thomas  junr aged: 48: years who testifieth & saith yt som years sinc one sumer one of my Cows was very often milked & som times tow of them in my yard by my house: & thinking to Cach ye milker: I took paines & watched & one with me & thos nights yt I watched my Cowes were not milked & I arose one night a Litele before day: & stood in my indien Corn near whare my Cowes Lay & sone I saw a female stand in ye midele of ye yeard. whar ye cowes ware which by hear atier I thought was [Rachell Hatfell Clenton] _clenton_rachel  which as I thought uanished a way: & another night I a rose before day & walked in ye street & just one ye breaking of day Came sudingly to my yeard wheare my Cowes Lay & that Cow that was most comonly milked stood & a parson a milking which presenly glanced from ye cow in ye Lickenesse of a gray Cat & run up ye back side of my house Scraching upon ye Shingells a bought fourty foot: & so ouer ye top of my house & furthersaith not=Except yt ye Spring following the same Cow was found dead on ye Common, not mired nor Cast. nor throw poverty, or any Disease yt we know of.(Collection 77, Box 1, Folder 19, Maine Historical Society, Portland, ME.)

content: SWP No. 90.1(Examination of [Jane Lilly] _lilly_jane  and [Mary Colson] _colson_mary  )[September 5, 1692 ][Jane Lilly] _lilly_jane  examined before their Majests Justices: att salem sept'r. 5th 1692  Jno. Hawthorn Esq'r:  & othersWhen s'd [Lilly] _lilly_jane  was brought into: the Court of Justices: [Mary Warin] _warren_mary  [Eliz Boothe] _booth_elizabeth  and others of the afflicted were struck Down into a dredful fitt: & recovered again by a touch of s'd [Lillyes] _lilly_jane  hand: [Mary Warin] _warren_mary  [Allice Booth.] _booth_alice  & [susanna Post] _post_susannah  & [Mrs. Mary Marshall] _marshall_mary  was asked who struck them down. They answered that it was s'd [Lilly] _lilly_jane  It: was s'd to her: [Jane Lilly] _lilly_jane  you are acused for afflicting [Mrs. Mary Marshall] _marshall_mary  by witchcraft: & now you have hurt many others: now you have an opportunity to: tell the truth: in this matter: but she answered: the truth was she knew nothing of it nor was she Sencible that she was in the devills snare [Mary Warin] _warren_mary  s'd she had sometimes Come to Procters hous but: she denyed that ever she had: had: any Conference with Procter or his wife: she would not own: that she had any hand in killing of [W'm Hooper] _hooper_william  : or in firing the hous: while he lay dead in it: or if she knew of his being killed with a Spear she: was bid to speak the truth: & she s'd she would for god was a god of truth: & she presently Spoke very hoars: [Mary Warin] _warren_mary  coming out of a fitt & other of the afflicted sayd that the black man Choaked her: when she say god was a god of truth: [Sam'll Wardwell:] _wardwell_samuel  also s'd there was sever'l Gallans of wine that day prepared for [W'm Hoopers] _hooper_william  buriall: that was drunk up: and there was five shouts made in triumph at what they had done: [Jno Brown sen'r] _brown_john_sr  s'd he heard a shouting about that time: that [Hoopers] _hooper_william  hous was fired: the hous was on fire in the roofe first: both Maj'r Swayne [Jno. Brown Sen'r] _brown_john_sr  Declared: it was told &  s'd [Lilly] _lilly_jane  that she s'd: when goodwife Rice was taken up now we shall be Deprived of Drinking of sider:[sarah Churchill] _churchill_sarah  s'd she had seen s'd [Lilly] _lilly_jane  att prison w'th Procters wife but she Denyed it: [Lilly] _lilly_jane  looked on the afflicted persons again &: severall of  them fell down: being struck down with her look & by touch of her hand were helped up again & was well: Wardwell also s'd that s'd [Lilly] _lilly_jane  : did triumph: when she went away from the firing of [Hoopers] _hooper_william  hous but she s'd she was in her own hous all that time & that she never went: in body nor spirit nor had ever had any [inclynason] to witchcraft: Maj'r Sway told her she had bin a frequenter of [DuStins] _dustin_lydia  hous: but she s'd if she confessed any thing of this she should Deny the truth & wrong her own soul:this is the Substance of [Jane Lillyes] _lilly_jane  : examination:  Attest [*Simon Willard.] _willard_simon   Mary Coulston examined before said Justices for the Maj'ties Sept. 5. 1692 [Jno. content: SWP No. 90.2(Recognizance for [Jane Lilly] _lilly_jane  )[December 8, 1692]Memorandum:That on the Eighth Day of December 1692 in the fourth Year of the Reign of our Sovereign Lord & Lady William & Mary by the Grace of God of England: &c King & Queen Defenders of the faith personally Appeared before us [James Russell] _russell_james  & [Samu'll Heman] _hayman_samuel  Esq'rs. of their Majestes Councill: & Province of the Massachusets bay in New Engld & Justices of peace within the same; [John; Pierson;] _pierson_john  [George Lilly] _lilly_george  & [Ruben Lilly] _lilly_ruben  all of Linn: husbandmen in the County of Essex And Acknowledged themselves and Each of them to be Indebted Unto our S'd Lord & Lady the King & Queen & the Survivor of them their heires & Successors in the some of Two hundred Pounds to be Leavied on their or Either of there Goods or Chattells Lands or Tenements for the use of sd Lord & Lady the King & Queen or Survivor of them if Default be made in performance of the Condition und'r written Viz -- The Condition of the Above Recognizance is Such that whereas [Jane Lilly] _lilly_jane  of Reading in the County of Middlesex wass commited to Goall on Suspition of Witchcraft; If therefore the above S'd [Jane Lilly] _lilly_jane  Shall make her personall Appearance before the Justices of Our S'd Lord & Lady the King & Queen at the next Court of Assizes Oyer & Terminer And Generall Goall Delivery to be holden for & within the County of Middls'x: to Answer what Shall be Objected Against her in their Majests: behalf Refering to Witchcraft And to do & Receive that w'ch by S'd. Court Shall be then and there Injoned her not to Depart with out Licence then the Above Recognizance to be void or elce to Remain in full force And Virtue                    [Ja: Russell] _russell_james                  P'r [Samuell Hayman] _hayman_samuel   (Reverse) Recogniz. case_title: SWP No. 080: Margaret Jacobs
title: ( Letter of Margaret Jacobs to George Jacobs, Jr., from Prison )
content: SWP No. 80.3( Letter of [Margaret Jacobs] _jacobs_margaret  to [George Jacobs, Jr.] _jacobs_george_jr , from Prison )[August 20, 1692]From the Dungeon  in Salem-Prison,  August 20. 92.Honoured Father,After my Humble Duty Remmbered to you, hoping in the Lord of your good Health, as Blessed be God I enjoy, tho in abundance of Affliction, being close Confined here in a loathsome Dungeon, the Lord look down in mercy upon me, not knowing how soon I shall be put to Death, by means of the Afflicted Persons; my Grand-Father having Suffered already, and all his Estate Seized for the King. The reason of my Confinement is this, I having, through the Magistrates Threatnings, and my own Vile and Wretched Heart, confessed several things contrary to my Conscience and Knowledg, tho to the Wounding of my own Soul, the Lord pardon me for it; but Oh! the terrors of a wounded Conscience who can bear. But blessed be the Lord, he would not let me go on in my Sins, but in mercy I hope so my Soul would not suffer me to keep it in any longer, but I was forced to confess the truth of all before the Magistrates, who would not believe me, but tis their pleasure to put me in here, and God knows how soon I shall be put to death. Dear Father, let me beg your Prayers to the Lord on my behalf, and send us a Joyful and Happy meeting in Heaven. My Mother poor Woman is very Crazey, and  remembers her kind Love to you, and to Uncle, viz.  D. A. So leaving you to the protection of the Lord, I rest your Dutiful Daughter, [Margaret Jacobs.] _jacobs_margaret  ( Robert Calef. More Wonders Of The Invisible World, Display’d In Five Parts. (London: Nath. Hillard, 1700), pp. 105–106.)

case_title: SWP No. 080: Margaret Jacobs
title: ( Petition of Margaret Jacobs )
content: SWP No. 80.4( Petition of [Margaret Jacobs] _jacobs_margaret  )[+ January 4, 1693]The humble declaration of [Margaret Jacobs] _jacobs_margaret  unto the honoured court now sitting at Salem, shewethThat whereas your poor and humble declarant being closely confined here in Salem goal for the crime of witchcraft, which crime thanks be to the Lord I am altogether ignorant of, as will appear at the great day of judgment: May it please the honoured court, I was cried out upon by some of the possessed persons, as afflicting them; whereupon I was brought to my examination, which persons at the sight of me fell down, which did very much startle and affright me. The Lord above knows I knew nothing, in the least measure, how or who afflicted them; they told me, without doubt I did, or else they would not fall down at me; they told me, if I would not confess, I should be put down into the dungeon and would be hanged, but if I would confess I should have my life; the which did so affright me, with my own vile wicked heart, to save my life; made me make the like confession I did, which confession, may it please the honoured court, is altogether false and untrue. The very first night after I had made confession, I was in such horror of conscience that I could not sleep for fear the devil should carry me away for telling such horrid lies. I was, may it please the honoured court, sworn to my confession, as I understand since, but then, at that time, was ignorant of it, not knowing what an oath did mean. The Lord, I hope, in whom I trust, out of the abundance of his mercy, will forgive me my false forswearing myself. What I said, was altogether false against my grandfather, and [Mr. Burroughs] _burroughs_george  , which I did to save my life and to have my liberty; but the Lord, charging it to my conscience, made me in so much horror, that I could not contain myself before I had denied my confession, which I did though I saw nothing but death before  me, chusing rather death with a quiet conscience, than to live in such horror, which I could not suffer. Where, upon my denying my confession, I was committed to close prison, where I have enjoyed more felicity in spirit, a thousand times, than I did before in my enlargement.And now, may it please your honours, your declarant, having, in part, given your honours a description of my condition, do leave it to your honours pious and judicious discretions, to take pity and compassion on my young and tender years, to act and do with me, as the Lord above and your honours shall see good, having no friend, but the Lord, to plead my cause for me; not being guilty in the least measure of the crime of witchcraft, nor any other sin that deserves death from man; and your poor and humble declarant shall for ever pray, as she is bound in duty, for your honours happiness in this life and eternal felicity in the world to come. So prays your honours declarant.[Margaret Jacobs.] _jacobs_margaret  (Thomas Hutchinson, The History of the Province of Massachusetts-Bay, vol. 2, ed. Lawrence Shaw Mayo (Cambridge, MA: Harvard University Press, 1936), pp. 30–31.)

[George Burroughs] _burroughs_george  )[August 2, 1692][Mary Webber] _webber_mary  wid aged aboute 53 years Testifieth and sayth that  she liveing at Casco Bay aboute six or seaven years agoe, when  [George Burroughs] _burroughs_george  was Minester at s'd place, and liveing a neerer --  Neighbour to s'd [Burroughs] _burroughs_george  , was well acquainted with his wife  w'ch was dauter to [mr John Ruck] _ruck_john  of Salem she hath heard her tell  much of her husband unkindness to her and that she dare not wright  to her father to acquaint [him] how it was with her, and soe desired mee to wright to her father that he would be pleased to send for her and told mee she had beene much affrighted, and that something  in the night made anoise in the chamber where she lay as if one Went  aboute the Chamber, and she calling up the negro. to come to her  the negro not Comeing sayd that she could not Come some thing  stopt her, then her husband being called he came up. some thing   Jumped down from between the Chimney & the side of the house  and Run down the stairs and s'd [Burroughs] _burroughs_george  followed it down, and  the negro then s'd it was something like a white calfe: another tyme  lyeing with her husband some thing came into the house and stood  by her bed side and breathed on her, and she being much affrighted  at it, would have awakened her husband but could not for a considerable tyme, but as soone as he did awake it went away., but this  I heard her say. and know nothing of it myselfe otherwise Except by  common report of others also concerning such things Salem  August 2'd 1692                     [*mary webber] _webber_mary  (Reverse) Mary Webber ve. [George Burroughs] _burroughs_george  )[+ August 5, 1692]The depotion of [Hannah Harres] _harris_hannah  Aiged twenty seven yeares or  thareabouts Testifieth and saith that she Lived at the hous of [Georg Burros] _burroughs_george  at falmouth & the above said [hannah harres] _harris_hannah  many times hath taken notic that when she hath had anny Discorse with the  above said [burross] _burroughs_george  wife when the above said [burros] _burroughs_george  was from hom  that apone has Returne he hath often scolded wife and told her that he knew what they said when he was abroad and further saith  that upone a time when his wife had Laine In Not above one weak  that he fell out with his wife and kept her by Discorce at the Dore  till she fell sicke In the place and grew wors at night so that the  above said [hannah harres] _harris_hannah  was afraid she would dye and thay called  In thare Naibours and the a bove said [burroses] _burroughs_george  Daughter told One  of the women that was thare the cause of her mothers Ellness and  the a bove said [burros] _burroughs_george  chid his Daughter for telling and the a bove said [burros] _burroughs_george  Came to the a bove said [hannah harres] _harris_hannah  and told her If  that his wif Did otherwise than well she should not tell of It  & the abovsaid [hannah harres] _harris_hannah  told him that she would not be confined to anny such thing    Jurat in Curia   (Reverse) [Hannah Harris] _harris_hannah ag't [Burroughs] _burroughs_george ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 2, no. 32. content: SWP No. 22.17(Deposition of [Ann Putnam, Jr.] _putnam_ann_jr  v. [George Burroughs] _burroughs_george  )[August 3, 1692]The Deposition of [Ann putnam:] _putnam_ann_jr  who testifieth and saith that on  20'th of April 1692 :at evening she saw the Apperishtion of a Minister  at which she was greviously affrighted and cried out oh dreadfull:  dreadfull here is a minister com:what are Ministers wicthes to: whence  com you and What is your name for I will complaine of:you tho you  be A minister: if you be a wizzard; and Immediatly I was tortored  by him being Racked and all most choaked by him: and he tempted  me to write in his book which I Refused with loud out cries and said  I would not writ in his book tho he tore me al to peaces but tould  him that it was a dreadfull thing: that he which was a Minister that  should teach children to feare God should com to perswad poor  creatures to give their souls to the divill: oh. dreadfull tell me your  name that I may know who you are: then againe he tortored me  & urged me to writ in his book: which I Refused: and then presently  he tould me that his name was [George Burroughs] _burroughs_george  and that he had  had three wives: and that he had bewitched the Two first of them to  death: and that he kiled [Mist. Lawson] _lawson_mistress  because she was so unwilling  to goe from the village and also killed [Mr Lawsons] _lawson_deodat  child because he  went to the eastward with Sir Edmon and preached soe; to the  souldiers and that he had bewicthed a grate many souldiers to death  at the eastword, when Sir Edmon was their. and that he had made  [Abigail Hobbs] _hobbs_abigail  a wicth and: severall wicthes more: and he has continewed ever sence; by times tempting me to write in his book and  greviously tortoring me by beating pinching and almost choaking me severall times a day and he also tould me that he was above wicth  for he was a cunjurer                                                                    Jurat in Curia  wee whose names are under writen being present with [Ann putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  att the time above mentioned hard hir declare what is above  writen what she said she saw and hard from the Apperishtion of [Mr. George Burroughs] _burroughs_george  : and allso beheld hir tortors:and perceived  her hellish temtations by hir loud out cries I will not I will not writ  tho you torment al days of my life:and being conversant with hir ever sence have  #[every day] seen hir tortored and complaining that [Mr. Burroughs] _burroughs_george   hirt hir.and tempts hir to writ in his Book                                                                [Edward Putnam]?tag/putnam_edward                                                                 #([Robert Morrell] _morrill_robert  )                                                                [Thomas putnam] _putnam_thomas_jr                                                                 [peter prescott] _prescott_peter Ann Puttnam declared har above written evidence tobe the truth:before the Jury of Inquest: Aug'st 3: 92: upon her oath[Ezekiel Chever] _cheever_ezekiel made Oath to the latter part.of this paper                        Jurat in Curia(Reverse) Ann putnam ag'stBurroughs ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 2, no. 24.
