case_title: SWP No. 097: Alice Parker Executed, September 22, 1692
title: (Examination of Alice Parker )
content: SWP No. 97.1(Examination of [Alice Parker] _parker_alice  )[May 12, 1692. ]The Examination of [Alice Parker] _parker_alice  12 May. 1692. Q [Mary Warren] _warren_mary  Charges you with Several acts off witchcraft; what Say you to it Guilty or not Guilty: A. I am not Guilty. You told her this day you cast away [Thomas Westgate] _westgate_thomas  -- A. I know nothing of it -- You told her John Laptho[rn] was lost in [lost]  A. I never spoke a word to her in my Life. You told her also you bewitched her sister, because her father would not mow your grass. I never saw her -- [Warren] _warren_mary  desiring to go to strike her, was permitted, but Could not Come near so much as to touch her, but fel backward immediately into a dreadful fitt. [Margaret Jacobs] _jacobs_margaret  Charged her also to her face with seeing her in the North feild on fryday night last about #[nine a Clock] an hour within Night in apparition -- Marshal [Herrick] _herrick_george  also affirmed to her face that she told him this day after he had apprehended her and was bringing her to Examination, that there were threscore Witches of the Company, which he denyed not, But said she did not Remember, how many she said there was. But [John Loader] _louder_john  being by attested the same the Marshal had before. [Mary Warren] _warren_mary  was grieviously afflicted dureing the whole time of her Examination. But being asked who told her there were threescore Witches, she answered she Could not tell. [Mary Warren] _warren_mary  affirmd that Her Father having promised to mow the grass for her if he had time, which he not doeing she came to the house, and told him he had better he had done it, presently after that Her Sister fell ill and shortly after Her Mother was taken ill, and dyed. [Mary Warren] _warren_mary   affirms that when [Alice Parker] _parker_alice  brought the Poppet to her, she said if she would not Run the needle in, she would Run itt, into her heart. [Mary Warren] _warren_mary  affirmd it to her face, but upon the Glance of [Parkers] _parker_alice  Ey she immediately struck her down into a fitt. being Examined upon these things, she wished God would open the Earth and Swallow her up presently, if one word of this was true and make her an Example to Others -- Tho att the same times she practised her Witchcrafts before upon the Body of [Mary Warren] _warren_mary , dreadfully tormenting her. Moreover [Warren] _warren_mary  affirmed that she told her this day that she was att the Bloody Sacrament in [mr Parris's] _parris_samuel  Pasture, and that they were about thirty of them. [Mary Warren] _warren_mary  also affirms that she told her this day also that she Ran after [John Loader] _louder_john  in the Common. [Mary Warren] _warren_mary  affirms that the Spectrum came direct from her Body and afflicted her dureing the whole time off her Examination. Mr Noise in Time of Examination affirmed to her face, that he being with her in a Time of sicknes, discoursing with about her witchcrafts whether she were not Guilty, she answered If she was as free from Other sins as from Witchcrafts she would not ask the Lord mercy. [Mary. Warren] _warren_mary  being taken with a dreadful fit at the same time, w'rby her tongue hung out of her mouth until it was black, [Parker] _parker_alice  being present said warrens tongue would be blacker befor she dyed. [Parker] _parker_alice  being asked why she did thus afflict and torm't her, answered If I do, the Lord forgive mee --( Witchcraft Papers, No. 31. Massachusetts Historical Society, Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 097: Alice Parker Executed, September 22, 1692
title: (Indictment No. 1 of Alice Parker, for Afflicting Mary Walcot)
content: SWP No. 97.2(Indictment No. 1 of [Alice Parker] _parker_alice , for Afflicting [Mary Walcot] _walcott_mary )[+ September 7, 1692. ]Essex in the Province of the Massachusetts Bay New England ss/ Anno RR's & Reginae Gulielmi & Mariae &c Quarto, Annoq'e Domini 1692/ ss/ The Juriors for our Sov'r Lord and Lady the King and Queen doe present That [Alice Parker] _parker_alice  wife of [John Parker] _parker_john  of Salem in the County Essex Fisherman #[In the County of Essex] the Sixth day of September #[in the yeare afore s'd]In the yeare aforesaid and divers other days and times as well before as after Certaine detestable arts called Witchcraft and Sorceries  Wickedly Mallitiouslynd felloniously hath used practised and Exercised At and in the Towne of Salem in the County of Essex -- aforesaid in upon and against one [Mary Walcot] _walcott_mary  -- of Salem Village in-the-County -- aforesaid Single-Woman -- by which said Wicked acts the said [Mary Walcott] _walcott_mary  the day & Yeare aforesaid and divers other days & Times both before and after was and is Tortured aflicted Consumed Pined Wasted & Tormented and also for sundry other acts of Witchcraft by the said [Allice Parker] _parker_alice  Committed and done before and since that time against the peace of our Sov'r Lord and Lady the King and Queen theire Crowne and Dignity and the form of the Stattute in that case made and ProvidedWitnesses[Ann Putman] _putnam_ann_jr [Mary Warren] _warren_mary [Eliz: Hubard] _hubbard_elizabeth (Reverse) [Alice Parker] _parker_alice [Mary Walcott] _walcott_mary ( Witchcraft Papers No. 33. Massachusetts Historical Society, Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 097: Alice Parker Executed, September 22, 1692
title: ( Testimony of Martha Dutch v. Alice Parker )
content: SWP No. 97.4( Testimony of [Martha Dutch] _dutch_martha  v. [Alice Parker] _parker_alice  )[September 7, 1692. ]The Testimony of [Martha Dutch] _dutch_martha  aged about 36 years This Deponent Testifieth and saith that about 2 yeers Last past [Jno Jarman] _jarman_john  of Salem Coming in from sea I This deponant & [Alice parker] _parker_alice  of Salem Both of us standing Together said unto her w't a great mercy itt was for to see Them Come home well and Through mercy I said my husband had gone & Came home well many Times & I This deponant did saye unto the s'd [parker] _parker_alice  that I did hope he would Come whome This voyage well allso & the s'd [parker] _parker_alice  made answer unto me & said no Never more in This world the w'ch Came to pass as she then told me for he died abroad as I sertinly heare             Jurat in Curia Sep'r 7. 92.attest [*Step. Sewall] _sewall_stephen  Cle(Reverse) [Martha Dutch] _dutch_martha  Depo against [John Jarman] _jarman_john ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 2, No. 93, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archives, Boston, MA. ). )

case_title: SWP No. 097: Alice Parker Executed, September 22, 1692
title: (Depositions of Sarah Bibber Mary Walcott, Elizabeth Hubbard, Ann Putnam Putnam Jr., & Mary Warren v. Alice Parker, and Statement of Abigail Hobbs v. Alice Parker)
content: SWP No. 97.5(Depositions of [Sarah Bibber] _bibber_sara  Mary Walcott, Elizabeth Hubbard, Ann Putnam Putnam Jr., & Mary Warren v. [Alice Parker] _parker_alice , and Statement of Abigail Hobbs v. Alice Parker)[ September 7, 1692. ][Sarah Vibber] _bibber_sara : upon oath: affirmeth: to the #[grand] Jury of inquest: that she hath seen [Alice Parker:] _parker_alice  afflict: [Mary Warin] _warren_mary  [Mary Walcot:] _warren_mary  & [An Putnam:] _putnam_ann_jr  & that s'd [Parker] _parker_alice  did choke s'd [Warin] _warren_mary  the last night &  griped her: abo't the waste: Septem'r 7: 1692 & that she hath afflicted this deponent Jurat in Curia  [Mary Walcot] _walcott_mary : upon oath: affirmeth: to the Jury of inquest: that she hath: seen: [Alice Parker:] _parker_alice  afflict: [Mary Warin:] _warren_mary [Eliz Hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth  [Mercy Lewis:] _lewis_mercy  & [An Putnum] _putnam_ann_jr  perticulerly: the last night: by choaking of them & squeezing of them Septem'r 7: 1692 & that she aflicted this deponent Jurat in Curia  [Eliz Hubard] _hubbard_elizabeth : on oath affirmd to the Jury of inquest: that [Alice Parker:] _parker_alice  hath once afflicted her: & that was last night; Sept'r 7: 1692 [An Putnum:] _parker_alice  upon oath: affirmd: to the Jury of Inquest: that she hath seen: [Alice Parker] _parker_alice  afflict: [Mary: Warin:] _warren_mary  [Mary Walcot:] _walcott_mary  [goodwife Vibber] _bibber_sara  &[Sara Churchell] _churchill_sarah  by Choking: of them & squeezing. [Mary Warin;] _warren_mary  this they did the last night in the Court: Septem'r 7: 16:92[An Putnum] _putnam_ann_jr : upon oath: affirmed: to ye Jury of Inquest: that she hath seen: Alice Parker aflict: Mary: Warin: [Mary Walcot] _walcott_mary : goodwife [Vibber] _bibber_sara : & Sara Churchell by choking: of them & squeezing. Mary Warin: this they did ye last night in ye Court:Septem 7: 16:92[Mary: Warin] _warren_mary  : upon oath: affirms to the Jury of Inquest: that: she hath seen [Alice Parker] _parker_alice  afflict: [Mary Walcot:] _walcott_mary  [Eliz Hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth  [An Putnam:] _putnam_ann_jr  & [goodwife Vibber] _bibber_sara  the last night: by choking: them & squeezing them: s'd [Parker:] _parker_alice  has afflicted me: has brought me the book: to siign to she brought: me a poppit: & a needle: & thretned: to stab: me if I would not stick the needle into the Poppit: & she did run: the needle a little way into me: s'd Parker s'd she was a caus: of the death of Tho Wastgate: and crew: that was foundred in the sea: she was also a caus: of the death of goodwife ormes her son: that was drown'd before: there dore: and was a caus of the death of [Jno Serles] _serles_john  his -- boy: she was the caus also of: [Michael Chapmans:] _chapman_michael  Death in Boston harbour: she also told me she: bewiched my mother & was a caus of her death: also that: she bewiched my sister: [Eliz:] _wardwell_elizabeth  that is both deaf & dumb: September: 7. 92  Jurat in Curia  [Abigail: Hobbs] _hobbs_abigail : afirms: she has seen: Alice Parker:  afflict: [Mary: Warin:] _warren_mary  when s'd [Warin] _warren_mary  was at prison. Also: I have seen her: aflict: [An Putman:] _putnam_ann_jr  by Choking: of them: Septem'r 7: 1692:  before the Jury of Inquest (Reverse) Several Afflicted p'rsonsEviences( Witchcraft Papers, No. 34. Massachusetts Historical Society, Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 097: Alice Parker Executed, September 22, 1692
title: (Deposition of Thomas Putnam & William Murray v. Alice Parker)
content: SWP No. 97.6(Deposition of [Thomas Putnam] _putnam_thomas_jr  & [William Murray] _murray_william  v. [Alice Parker] _parker_alice )[+ September 7, 1692]:the deposistion of [Tho: putnam] _putnam_thomas_jr  aged 40: years and [william murry] _murray_william  aged 36: year. who: testifieth and saith: that several of the afflected: perzens were as [mary walcott] _walcott_mary  and [mary warren] _warren_mary  and seuerall other and were much afflected on the: 6th Septr. 1692 dureing the time of the Examination of [Elce parker] _parker_alice : and we obsarved that upon the glance of hir Eies they were strucken down: and upon hir laying hir hand on them they were Recovered and we beleave that [Elce parker] _parker_alice  the prisoner att the barr has often hurt the said persons by acts of witchcrafJurat in Curia [Thomas putnam] _putnam_thomas_jr  [Wm Murray] _murray_william (Reverse:) [Tho: putnam] _putnam_thomas_jr  &[Wm Murray] _murray_william [Elsi Parker] _parker_alice ( Essex County Court Achives, Salem -- Witchcraft, vol. 2, No. 97, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archives, Boston, MA. ) )

case_title: SWP No. 097: Alice Parker Executed, September 22, 1692
title: ( Deposition of John Westgate v. Alice Parker )
content: SWP No. 97.7( Deposition of [John Westgate] _westgate_john  v. [Alice Parker] _parker_alice  )[June 2, 1692][Jno Wesgate] _westgate_john  aged about forty years This deponant Testifyeth thatt about Eight years since he being att the house of [mr Sam'll Beadle] _beadle_samuel  In the company of [Jno Parker] _parker_john  and severall others, the wife of said [Jno Parker] _parker_john  came into the company and scolded att and called her husband all to nought whereupon I the said deponent tooke her husbands part telling of her itt was an unbeseeming thing for her to come after him to the taverne and raile after thatt rate w'th thatt she came up to me and called me rogue and bid me mind my owne busines and told me I had better have said nothing Sometimes afterwards I the s'd deponent going from the house of [mr Dan'll King,] _king_daniel  w'n I came over against [Jno Robinsons] _robinson_john  house I heard a great noyce coming from  towards mr Babage his house then there apeared a black hogge running towards me w'th open mouth as though he would have devoured me att thatt Instant time I the said. deponent fell downe upon my hipp and my knife runn into my hipp up to the haft w'n I came home my knife was in my sheath w'n I drew itt out of the sheath then imediatly the sheath fell all to peaces, and further this deponant testifieth thatt after he gott up from his fall his stockin and shue was full of blood and thatt he was forc't to craule along by the fence all the way home and the hogg followed him and never left him tell he came. home, and haveing astout dog then with mee, the dog run then away from him Leapeing over the fence and Cryeing much which at other tymes used to Wory any hog well or Sufficiently, (Reverse) which hog I then apprehended was Either the Divell or some Evill thing not a Reall hog, and did then Really Judge or determine in my mind that it was Either Goody parker or by her meenes, and procureing fearing that she is a Witch,                                                              Sworne Salem June 2'd 1692                                                              Before [*John Hathorne] _hathorn_john  Assis't[Jno Wastgate] _westgate_john  declared the above written & what is written on the other side of this paper to be a true evidence before the Jury of Inquest upon the oath he hath taken: Septem'r 7: 1692                                                  Jurat in Curia  [John Westgate] _westgate_john ag't #[Mary]  [Parker Alice] _parker_alice  [several illegible words]( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 2, No. 66 )

case_title: SWP No. 097: Alice Parker Executed, September 22, 1692
title: ( Testimony of John Bullock v. Alice Parker )
content: SWP No. 97.8( Testimony of [John Bullock] _bullock_john  v. [Alice Parker] _parker_alice  )[+ September 7, 1692. ][Jno Bullock] _bullock_john  aged 36 years testifieth that aboute the middle of January last past one of my neighbors told me that [mrs park'r] _parker_alice  did lay upon the durt & Snow if I did not take care of her that she would perish where upon I did desire Some men that were in mye hous to goe & help her: & when they Came to her that they would not meddle because they thought she was ded there being a neighbor by said she saw her before in such kind of fits: then I perswaded one man bye; to take her upon his Shoulders & Carrye her home but in a little way going he let her fall upon a place of Stones: w'ch did not awake her w'ch Caused me to thinke she was really dead after that wee Carryed her into her hous & Caused her Cloaths to be taken of & while we were taking of her Cloaths to put her into bed She rises up & laughs in o'r faces.  [Martha Dutch] _dutch_martha  aged abo't 36 years: testifyeth: to the A bove written and farthar saith that I have sene said parker in such a Condition severall othar tims                                            Jurat in Curia  Sep'r 7: 92.  [*S Sewall] _sewall_stephen  Cle (Reverse) [John Bullock] _bullock_john  depo ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 2, no. 67, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archives, Boston, MA. ) )

case_title: SWP No. 097: Alice Parker Executed, September 22, 1692
title: ( Testimony of Samuel Shattuck v. Alice Parker )
content: SWP No. 97.9 ( Testimony of [Samuel Shattuck] _shattuck_samuel  v. [Alice Parker] _parker_alice  )[+ September 7, 1692]  [Samll Shattock] _shattuck_samuel  aged 41 years testifieth that in the year 1685: Goodwife  ?  Parker wife to [Jno Parker] _parker_john  Mariner Came to my hous: & went into the room where my wife & Children were & fauned upon my wife wth very Smooth words in a Short tyme after that Child wch was Supposed to haue bin vnder an ill hand for Seuerall years before: was taken in a Strange & unuceall maner as if his vitalls would have broak out his breast boane drawn upto gather to the uper part of his brest his neck & Eys drawne Soe much aside as if they would never Come to right againe he lay in So Strange a maner that the Docter & others did beleive he was bewitched Soom daysafter Som of the vissiters Cut Som of his hair of to boyle wch they Saide altho they did wth great tendernes ye Child would Shreek out as if he had bin tormented: they put his hair in a Skillet over a fier: wch Stood plaine on the hearth and as Son as they were gon out of the room it was throwne downe & i came immediatly into the room & Could See no Creature in the room they put it on againe & after it had boyled Som tyme the above Said Goodwife Parker Came in & asked if i would buye Soom Chickeens I told her no: the women that were above in the Chamber Said to me it is pitty you did not ask to See her chickens for they did beleiue she had none to Sell: and aduised me to Send to her hous to buy Som wch i did & the messenger brought me word that She told him She had none & that the woman that lived in the Same hous told him that the Said Parker had not had any in three weeks before: Soom days after She wth her husband & two men moor Came to mye hous & to answer their request i went to them: She asked me if i Saide She had bewitched mye Child I told her I did belive She had: She Said to me yow are a wicked man: the lord avenge me of you the lord bring vengance upon you for y r  this wrong: one of the men asked her what made you Com to this hous last Saturday She Saide to Sell Chicken: why did not yow let him have them when he Sent for them Said he: She Said becaus She had Sold them he asked to whome She Saide to Such a one: wee Sent presently to the party: & the answer was brought us that he never bought any of h e [Lost] [= her] well you See Saide they you have told us that wch is not true what did yow wth them She was at a Stand but at last Said her Son Carryed them to Sea wth him: her husband told her that was not true for her Son went to Sea last fryday: & if hed had Carryed them to Sea She Could not brough them here the Saturday following She could not give any true account what She did w't them: but went into the room where the Child  was & told my wife that She was a wicked woman for Saying Soe of her: & told  my wife in these words I hope I Shall See the downfall of you my wife told me and Soe went away in a great anger: & this is all true & reall to the uttermost of my remembrance & after this threatning or EuillJurat in Curia  (Reverse) Euill wishing the Child has Continued in a very Sad Conditionfowllow[ed] w'th very Solem fits w'ch hath taken away his understanding  Jurat in Curia  [Samll Shattock] _shattuck_samuel  agst [parker] _parker_alice .  ( Essex County Court Archives, vol. 2, no. 65, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archives, Boston, MA. ) )

content: SWP No. 64.1Warrant for the Apprehension of [Mary Green] _green_mary  and [Hannah Bromage] _bromage_hannah[July 28, 1692][Sheriff?] of Essex or his dept or [cons]tables in Haverhill [Y]ou are in theire Majests names hereby Required to apprehend and forthwith or as soon as may be bring before us. Green] _green_mary  ye wife of [peter Green] _green_peter  of Haverhill Weaver and [Hanah Bromage] _bromage_hannah  the wife of [Edward Bromage] _bromage_edward  of haverhil husbandman who both stand Charged on behalfe of theire Majests with haveing Committed Sundry acts of Witchcraft on the Bodys [Timothy Swan] _swan_timothy  of [Mary Walcot] _walcott_mary  [Ann Putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  & whereby great hurt hath benne donne them, In order to theire, Examination Relateing to the abovesd premises faile notDated Salem July the 28th 1692[Bartho Gedney] _gidney_bartholomew [John Hathorne] _hathorn_john [Jonathan Corwin] _corwin_jonathan [John Higginson] _higginson_john  by vertue of this warrant I have S[eased] Hanah Bromage & mary green Cons[table]( Facsimile copy in John Fiske, New France and New England. case_title: SWP No. 064: Mary Green
title: Judgment v. John Shepherd for Assisting Mary Green to Escape
content: SWP No. 64.2Judgment v. John Shepherd for Assisting Mary Green to Escape[September 22, 1692]John Shepard of Rowley bound over by Thomas Wade Esq for Assisting and helping to Convey Mary Green a Prisoner for the Crime of Witchcraft out of their Majtes Goal in Ipswitch: Confest the fact.The Courts Judgemt is That he pay a fine of 30li money and Costs of Court. Vpon his Confession and Petition the Court Respits 25li Till further Orders, that he stand Committed till the five pounds and Costs be paid/( Records of the Salem and Ipswich Court of General Sessions of the Peace (1692–1693), p. 8. Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archives, Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 064: Mary Green
title: (Recognizance for Mary Green )
content: SWP No. 64.3(Recognizance for [Mary Green] _green_mary  )Memorandum [December 16, 1692]That on this Sixteenth Day of December Anno December one thousands Six hundred Ninety & two In the fourth Year of the Reigne of our Sovereigne Lord & Lady William & Mary by the Grace of God of England Scottland &c: King & Queen Defend'rs of the faith &c: Personally came and Appeared before me [George Corwin] _corwine_george  High Sherriffe of the County of Essex of the Province of Massetuthetts Bay in New England [Peter Green] _green_peter  of Haverell in the County afores'd. Weavor and [James Sanders] _sanders_james  of the said Towne Husbandman And Acknowledged themselves & Each of them to be indebted unto our s'd. Sovereigne Lord the King and Lady the Queen or the Surviver of them their Heires and Successo'rs: in the Summe of two hundred pounds to be Leaved on their goods and Chattles Lands & Tenements for the Use of our Sovereigne Lord and Lady the King & Queen or the Survivor of them if Default be made in the Performance of the Condition UnderwrittenVidellisettThe Condition of the Above written Recognizance is Such That whereas [Mary Green] _green_mary  Wife of the above bounden [Peter Greene] _green_peter  of Haverell is Suspected and accused of Committing acts of Witchcrafts If therefore the said [Mary Green] _green_mary  aforesaid Shall & do make her Personall Appearance before the Justices of our Said Sovereigne Lord & Lady the King & Queen at the Next Court of Assize Oyer & Terminer Next Generall Goal Delivery to be held for or within the County of Essex afores'd: to answer w't: shall be objected ag't: her on their Maj'tes: behalfe Refering to the Witchcrafts & to do and Receive That by which said Court Shall be then & there Injoyned and not Depart without Licence then the above Recognizance to be void or Else to abide and Remane in full force and Virtue In Wittness whereof the abovenamed Persons [Peter Green] _green_mary  & James  [Sanders] _sanders_james  have hereunto sett their hand & seales this sixteenth Day of December in the Year of our Lord one Thousand six hundred Ninty & two  and in the fourth year of their Maj'tes: Reigne:/Witnesse [Thomas beadle] _beadles_thomas              [Peter Green] _green_peter  [Daniel Lunt] _lunt_daniel                 James icc  [Sanders] _sanders_james [Jno: Gyles] _giles_john                       his   Marke          1692 ( Massachusetts Archives Collection, vol. 135, no. 72. Massachusetts State Archives, Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 109: William Proctor
title: (Warrant for the Apprehension of William Proctor, and Officer's Return)
content: SWP No. 109.1(Warrant for the Apprehension of [William Proctor] _proctor_william , and Officer's Return)[May 28, 1692] To the Constable  of SalemYou are hereby Required in theyr Majestyes Names to [William procter] _proctor_william  of Salem Farmes son of [John procter] _proctor_john  of s'd farmes Husbandman, upon Tuesday Next being the Thirty first day of May about Tenne of the Clock in the morning att the house of [Leu't Nath'll Ingersolls] _ingersoll_nathaniel  in s'd Village, Whoe stands Charged w'th Sundry Acts of Witchcraft done or Comitted upon the Bodys of [Mary Walcott] _walcott_mary  & [Susannah Shelden] _sheldon_susannah  & others of Salem Village to theyr great hurt, in order to his Examination, Relateing to the above s'd premises.and hereof You are nott to fayle dated. case_title: SWP No. 109: William Proctor
title: (Examination of William Proctor )
content: SWP No. 109.2(Examination of [William Proctor] _proctor_william  )[September 17, 1692]17 Sept:The Examination of [William Procter] _proctor_william  taken before [Jno hauthorn] _hathorn_john  Esq'r and other their majesties Justices 17 September 1692. He being s'd what he was acused of He lookeing upon [Mary Warrin] _warren_mary  struck her down and by toucheing of her Recovered her again -- [Mary Warrin] _warren_mary  said that [Wm Proctor] _proctor_william  had almost murdered her to death this day by pains in all her bones and Inwards also And that she saw him afflict [Mary Walcot] _walcott_mary  [Eliza booth] _booth_elizabeth , [Eliz' hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth  and [Ann putnam.] _putnam_ann_jr  The said [Mary Walcott] _walcott_mary  & [Ann Putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  being in dreadful fitts [Wm. Proctor] _proctor_william  recovered them again. [Alice booth] _booth_alice  & [Sarah Church] _churchill_sarah  in their fitts complained of [Proctor] _proctor_william  And he by touching them recovered them again. [Mary Pickworth] _pickworth_mary  was in a fitt & the above afflicted persons said they saw [Proctor] _proctor_william  afflict her, and he by his touch recovered her [Elizabeth Booth] _booth_elizabeth  said she saw him twist and pinch [poppet] this very Day. she also was afflicted and he recovered her by his touch. [Betty hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth  said [Proctor] _proctor_william  afflicted her greviously this Daye and made her promise not to tell of him. [Mary Walcot] _walcott_mary  said the same.[Eliz Hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth  owned before the Grand jury upon the oath she had taken that s'd [Will'm Proctor] _proctor_william  had aflicted her both befour her examination at that time, & since many times, notwithstanding his promise to her. as Attest                      [*Robert Payne] _payne_robert  Foreman. (Reverse) I underwritten being appoynted by authority to take the within examination in [wr']ting Doe testify upon oath taken in Court that this is a true coppy of the substance of it, to the best of my knowledge 7't Jan'ry 1692/3[*Wm Murray] _murray_william the within Wm procture was examined before their Majesties Justies of peace inSalemowned before the Grand Jury 7: Janr 1692atest. [Jno Higginson] _higginson_john  Just peace[Robert: Payne] _payne_robert  foreman:( Suffolk Court Files, Vol. 32, Docket no. 2706, p. 29, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archives, Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 109: William Proctor
title: (Indictment No. 1 of William Proctor, for Afflicting Elizabeth Hubbard, Returned Ignoramous )

case_title: SWP No. 109: William Proctor
title: ( Indictment No. 3 William Proctor , for Afflicting Mary Walcott, Returned Ignoramous )
content: SWP No. 109.5( Indictment No. 3 [William Proctor] _proctor_william  , for Afflicting Mary Walcott, Returned Ignoramous )[January 7, 1693]Province of the Massathusetts Bay in New England, Essex ] Anno RRs & Reginae Gulielmi & Mariae Angliae &c Quarto Annoq'e Domini 1692 The Jurors for our sovereigne Lord & Lady the King & Queen pr'sents That William Proctor of Salem in the County of Essex aforesaid --- On the seaventeenth Day of September 1692 -- And Divers other Dayes and Times as well before as after Certaine Detestable Artes called Witchcrafts & Sorceries Wickedly Mallishiously and felloniously --- hath Used Practised & Exercised at and in the Towne of Salem in the County of Essex afores'd upon and against one [Mary Walcott] _walcott_mary  of Salem aforsaid Single Woman --- By which wicked Arts the said [Mary Walcott] _walcott_mary  ---indictment  The Day and year afores'd and Divers other Dayes & Times as well before as after was and is Tortured Afflicted Tormented Consumed Pined & Wasted against the Peace of our Sovereigne Lord and Lady the King and Queen their Crowne and Dignity and against the Lawes in that case made & Provided.Wittnesses[Eliza' Hobert] _hubbard_elizabeth [Ann Puttnam] _putnam_ann_jr [Allice Booth] _booth_alice [Eliza' Booth] _booth_elizabeth (Reverse) Ignoramus[*Robert Payne] _payne_robert  foreman.( Suffolk Court Files, Vol. 32, Docket No. 2706, p. 29, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archives, Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 035: Sarah Cole (of Salem)
title: (Warrant for apprehension of Hannah Carroll & Sarah Cole (of Salem) & Officer's Return )
content: SWP No. 35.1(Warrant for apprehension of [Hannah Carroll] _carroll_hannah  & [Sarah Cole] _cole_sarah_salem  (of Salem) & Officer's Return )[September 15, 1692 ] To the Sheriffe of the County of Essex or #[their] his Deputy Complaint  haveing ben made to us their Majesties Justices of the Peace in Salem by [Henery Brage] _brage_henry  of Salem labourer against [Hannah Carrell] _carroll_hannah  wife of [Nathaniell Carell] _carroll_nathaniel  whele right. & [Sarah Coale] _cole_sarah_of_lynn  , wife of [Abraham Coale] _cole_abraham   of Salem Taylor. for that the Said [Hannah Carrell] _carroll_hannah  Did Sometimes one of them & Sometimes Both. together Severall Times ffeloniously  afflict Torture & Torment [William Brage] _brage_william  Son of [Henr' Brage] _brage_henry  by that  Diabollicall art of witchcraft, & the Said [Henr' Brage] _brage_henry  hath given in  bond to procecut his said Complaint to Effect./ These are therefore in their Majesties names to. -- require you forthwith to Apprehend  & Seize the Bodyes of the Said [Hanah Carrell] _carroll_hannah  & [Sarah Coale] _cole_sarah_of_lynn  & Bringe them before their Majesties Justices of the Peace in Salem in order to their Examination for w'ch this shall be your sufficient warrantDated in Salem:  10'th Sep'r 1692.                                                   [Bartho Gedney] _gidney_bartholomew                                                   [John Hathorne] _hathorn_john                                                   [Jonathan. Corwin] _corwin_jonathan                                                   [John Higginson] _higginson_john  (Reverse)  Sep 15'th 1692 By virture hereof I have apprehended the body of [Sarah Cole] _cole_sarah_salem  within  named and left her under Guard in the town of salem in order to her Examinationby me [*Geo. case_title: SWP No. 035: Sarah Cole (of Salem)
title: (Recognizance for Sarah Cole (of Salem) by Abraham Coal )
content: SWP No. 35.2(Recognizance for [Sarah Cole] _cole_sarah_salem  (of Salem) by [Abraham Coal] _cole_abraham  )[January 14, 1693 ]Memor'm. That on the fourteenth day of January 1692 in the fourth year  of the Reigne of our Soveraigne Lord & Lady William and Mary  by the Grace of God of [of] England &c King and Queen Defenders  of the faith &c Personally appeared before Jno Ha[] Esq'r one  of their Maj'ties Justices for the County of Essex #[There] [Abraham Cole] _cole_abraham  of Salem Taylor and acknowledged himselfe to be oweing and Indebted unto our said Soveraigne Lord and Lady and the survivor of them their Heires and Successors in the sum'e of fifty pounds money  to be Levied on his Lands and Tenements goods and Chattles for the  use of our s'd Soveraigne Lord and Lady the King and Queen or the  Survivor them on Condition That -- [Sarah Cole] _cole_sarah_salem  his wife shall [shall] personally appear before the Justices of our s'd Lord and Lady the King  & Queen at the next Court of Assizes & Gen'll Goall Delivery to be  holden for the County of Essex and in the mean time to be of Good  behaveour and then and there to answer to all Such matters and things as shall in their Maj'ties behaffe be alledged against her and to do and receive that w'ch by the said Court shall be then and there Injoyned her and thence not to depart without LycenceAttest  [*Joha. Elatson] _elatson_jonathan  Cler (Reverse)  Recognizance [Abraham Coal] _cole_abraham  of Salemfor [Sarah Coal] _cole_sarah_salem  his wifeAppeared & Clear'd by proclamation ( Massachusetts Archives Collection, Vol. 135 No. 108. case_title: SWP No. 050: Thomas Farrer Sr.
title: (Deposition of Ann Putnam, Jr., Thomas Putnam and Robert Morrill v. Thomas Farrar )
content: SWP No. 50.1(Deposition of [Ann Putnam, Jr.] _putnam_ann_jr , [Thomas Putnam] _putnam_thomas_jr  and [Robert Morrill] _morrill_robert  v. [Thomas Farrar] _farrer_thomas  )[+ May 16, 1692 ]the deposistion of [Ann putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  who testifieth and saith that on the: 8.th of may 1692 : there appeard to me the Apperishtion of an  old gray-head man with a great nose which tortored me and almost Choaked me and urged me to writ in his book: and I asked him what was his name and from whence he came for I would complaine of him: and he told me he came from linne and people used to call him old father pharoah and he said he was my grandfather: for my father used to call him father: but I tould I would not call him: grandfather: for he was a wizzard and I would complaine of him:  and ever sence he hath afflected me by times beating me and pinching me and all most Choaking me and urging me continewally to  writ in his bookwe whose names are under writen haveing been conversant with [Ann putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  have hard hir declare what is above writen what she said she saw & heard from the apperishtion of old pharoah and also have seen hir tortors: and perceived hir hellish temtations by hir loud out cries I will not writ old pharaoh I will not writ in your book                                    [Thomas putnam] _putnam_thomas_jr                                     [Roburt Morrell] _morrill_robert  (Reverse)  [Ann. putnam] _putnam_ann_jr  ag.           [Tho. ffarrer] _farrer_thomas  ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 2 no. 114. Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archives. Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 040: Mary De Rich

content: SWP No. 40.1(Warrant for the Apprehension of [Mary De Rich, and Officer's Return] _derich_mary  )[May 23, 1692 ] To the Marshall of the County of Essex or his Lawfull Deputy or Constable in SalemYou are in theyr Majests Names hereby required to apprehend and forthwith bring before us, [Mary de Rich] _derich_mary  the Wife of [Michaell de Rich] _derich_michall   of Salem farmes Husbandman, whoe stands Charged w'th Sundry Acts of Witchcraft by hir Comitted lately on the Bodys of [Abigall Williames] _williams_abigail  & [Elizabeth Hubbard] _hubbard_elizabeth  of Salem Village &c. whereby great hurt & Injury hath bin donne them in order to hir Exemination relateing to the same & hereof you are nott to fayle. case_title: SWP No. 025: Richard Carrier
title: (Warrant for the Apprehension of Richard Carrier and Andrew Carrier and Officer's Return)
content: SWP No. 25.1(Warrant for the Apprehension of [Richard Carrier] _carrier_richard  and [Andrew Carrier] _carrier_andrew  and Officer's Return)[July 21, 1692]To the Sherriffe of the County of Essex or Deputy or Constable  of Andover You are in their Majesties names hereby required to  Apprehend and forthwith bring before us [Richard Carrier] _carrier_richard  and  [Andrew Carrier] _carrier_andrew  Son of [Thomas Carier] _carrier_thomas_sr  of Andivor Husbandman who Stands charged on behalfe of their Majesties with haveing Comitted Sundry acts of wichcraft on the body of Mary Warren of Salem &c & that in order to his Examination relating to the abovesaid premisses and hereof Faile not & you are likewise to inquire after & make Serch for any paper or popetts.  that may relate to witchcraft. Dated in Salem 21 July 1692                                                            [Bartho' Gedney] _gidney_bartholomew                                                             [John Hathorn] _hathorn_john                                                             [Jonathan. Corwin] _corwin_jonathan                                                             [John Higginson] _higginson_john   Jus's Peace in obedience to this warrant I have sessedthe body of [richard carier] _carrier_richard  and [andrew carier] _carrier_andrew and have brought them to the house of [MrThomas [Beadle]:] _beadles_thomas  22 July 1692                                    By me [*John Ballard] _ballard_john   Constable in Andover ( MS Ch K 1.40, vol. 2, p. 208, Dept. of Rare Books and Manuscripts, Boston Public Library, Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 025: Richard Carrier
title: (Examinations of Richard Carrier, Mary Lacey Sr., Mary Lacey Jr., & Andrew Carrier, Copy )
content: SWP No. 25.2(Examinations of [Richard Carrier] _carrier_richard , [Mary Lacey Sr.] _lacey_mary_sr , [Mary Lacey Jr.] _lacey_mary_jr , & [Andrew Carrier] _carrier_andrew , Copy )[July 22, 1692]22th July 1692 [Richard Carrier] _carrier_richard  aged 18 years & His Brother [Andrew] _carrier_andrew  a'bt 16 years [Rich'd Carrier] _carrier_richard  & his brother brought into Court who unto many Questions propounded returend Negative Answers to all & the afflicted persons s'd they Saw the black man & there Mother w'th others stand before them on the Table to Hinder there Conffession --Q.M.L. did not [Rich'd] _carrier_richard  Joynee w'th. you In severall things A Yes & he burned [Timo Swan] _swan_timothy  w'th his Tobacco pipe Q Where was [Rich'd] _carrier_richard  when he did it A In [Swans] _swan_timothy  Chamber In Spirit Q Who Else Joyned In it A [Goody Carrier] _carrier_martha  My Ganmother & Mother & Rich'd Q. Was Rich'd there bodyly A his body Came to the house & his Spirit went In & did it -- Q were ye all bodyly in the Chamber A Somtimes we ware in Shapes & Somtimes in body but they did not See us She s'd further that they rod upon hand poles & the Divel also was there in the Shape of a black Man & high Crowned hatt & bid us Kill [Swan] _swan_timothy  by Stabing him to Death & we also Stick pinns Into his Liknes Q. and what Else had you any hott Irons or knitting Knedles A Yes we had an Iron Spindle & [Rich'd Carrier] _carrier_richard  ran it through or Into [Swans] _swan_timothy  Knee Q wher had you that Spindle A the Divel Brought it to us Q had you any quarrell w'th. him A we all Came in Upon [Mrs. Bradberys] _bradbury_mary  Acco' or quarrel She had w'th. him Q [Goody Lacey] _lacey_mary_jr  did not you hurt [Swan] _swan_timothy  . A No The daughter S'd. Yes Mother doe not deny it Q Goody Lacy who was in the Company A Goody Carrier & her Son [Mrs. Bradbery] _bradbury_mary  & wee Q were not the Mother there viz [foster] _foster_ann  A I know not but She Might be there Q. did You hurt him A the Divel made his Imps doe it Q w'ch way did you hurt him A there was hott Irons & the Divel  held them Q. the Daughter s'd it was an Iron Spindle A yes yes it was a Spindle Q. did you practise w'th. a Tobaco. pipe A I think once Q who was it that you hurt A [Timo. Swan] _swan_timothy  Q who held the pipe A the Divel & his Imps Q. had You any thing for his Sicknes A ther was athing before as it were -- [Goody Lacey] _lacey_mary_sr  were You in the Chamb'r w'th him A Yes [Q] w'ch way did you gett in A the Divel helped us in at the window And Mary Lacey s'd She sent in at the door Mary Lacey how maney was there A granmoth'r Goody Carrier [Rich'd Carriers] _carrier_richard  Mother & G. & [Mrs. Bradbery] _bradbury_mary  & we went upon the Divel & [Mrs. Bradb'y] _bradbury_mary  . acc't. who Came to us & brought us from our own home ---And we consented to Kill him if we were not brought out before, & here [Marey Lacey] _lacey_mary_jr  Related Somthing of the Quarrell between [Bradb'y] _bradbury_mary  . & Swan a'bt Thatching of a house -- Now [Rich'd Carrier] _carrier_richard  w't say you to these two Evidences that saw You w'th [Timo. Swan] _swan_timothy  , but Still he Denyed all -- Questions -- [Mary Lacey] _lacey_mary_jr  when you went to afflict [Ballard] _ballard_elizabeth  was not this man w'th You Viz Rich'd. Carrier A Yes & it was a'bt afortnight Since we went upon poles in the night we got into the house & this Rich'd. afflicted [Ballard] _ballard_elizabeth  by pinching & choaking her & I was ther also when the Sider was Drawn Goody Lacey doe you Remember anything of afflicting this [Ballard] _ballard_elizabeth  A Yes. and this Rich'd was there and afflicted by pinching choaking & Laying his hand on her Stomak [Mary Lacey] _lacey_mary_jr  Urged [Rich'd] _carrier_richard  very much to Confes & S'd further that he bid her help to kill [Swan] _swan_timothy  & that they used to discourse togeth'r on ther Jorneys & used to tell her he would goe and afflict persons, telling him he had ahart as hard as a Rock to Deny it, she s'd further that this [Rich'd] _carrier_richard  told her he would Kill [Goody ballard] _ballard_elizabeth  also Mary was it [Richard] _carrier_richard  pipe that burnt [Swan] _swan_timothy  A. Yes and it he did him Self & Run the Spindle into [Swans] _swan_timothy  knee he told me also that he would make his Broth'r one & afflict person [Mary Warrin] _warren_mary  in abad fitt & blood Runing out of her Mouth. [Mary Lacy] _lacey_mary_jr  S'd. that this Andrew did it. The afflicted persons were Grevously tormented that [Richa'd] _carrier_richard  and [Andrew] _carrier_andrew  were Carried out to another Cambbre and there feet & hands bound a Little while after [Rich'd] _carrier_richard  was brought In again Q Rich'd though you have been Verry Obstinate Yett tel us how long agoe it is Since you ware taken in this SnareA ayear Last May and Noe More Unto Many Questions Propounded he answered affermativly as followeth viz he Saw the Shape of a man In the night, he had been in twone & was Goeing home the man was Black & had a high Crowned hat he told me I was afrayd to goe home  & asked me what I Should be afraid of & proffered to goe a little way w'th me, he bid me Serve him & he would Gett me New Cloaths & give me a horse, he told me also that he was Christ, & I must beleve him, & I think I did Soe, I Sett my hand to his book it was a little Red book I wrought w'th a Stick & mad a red Colour w'h it & I promised to Serve him & at parting. hee bid bid me goodnight -- the 2nd time he Apeared to me was in the Shape of a Yellow Bird And told me. he had not performed his promise but would & that Shortly -- I was to doe Service a'bt the Children & afflicted persons he told me also of [Timo. Swan] _swan_timothy  & I must Give him leave to afflict him he asked my Consent also to afflict [Ballards wife] _balch_elizabeth  -- I also hurt the Images of persons or the liknes of them by Sqezing anything I had amind to, betwene my hands -- The 2nd Aperance was last January, It is not above amoth Since that I began to afflict [Swan] _swan_timothy  , I can not tell how long it is Since that I rod to Salem Village, I was ther twice & Rod w'th [Mary Lacey] _lacey_mary_jr  the Divel Carried us Somtimes in the Shape of a horse somtimes In the Shape of a Man the 1rst time he was ahorse the 2nd. time a Man, when he was a horse our pol lay a Crose the horse, when he was a man our pol was on his Sholder -- when We went to [ballard] _ballard_joseph  he was a man we ware at [ballards] _ballard_joseph  house and went in Somtimes at the Window & Somtimes at the Door, I goot the Sider out of the Sell'r. & Drew it in a pot belonging to the house & Drank it in the Orchard I fetcht the Sider my Self & went in my Spirit for it here [Mary Lacey] _lacey_mary_jr  S'd he went in his Spirit & his body lay dead the while & out of doors he s'd it was true --I hurt Swan in my Spirit & Struck him in the knee w'th a Spindle the Divel brought it & was then in the Shape of a black man & high Crowned hatt I afflicted [frys] _fry_eunice  Child by Squezing of it & I did it upon anything I had amind should represent the Child, my Mother was w'th me Somtimes but not often, -- Mother was bodyly w'th me -- I have Seen her once in her Spirit Since her Imprissonment & in the Shape of a Catt I was present when brother Signed the book & I think Mother was there also & the Divel -- I rod the 1st time on a horse & the 2nd time on a man to Salem Village & think there might be a Seventy there at Each Mettings, we mett in a Green w'ch was the Ministers paster -- And we were in two Companys at the Last I think there was a few Men w'th them I heard [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  talk of a minister or two -- one of them was he that had ben at the Estward  & preached once at the Village, his name Is [Burroughs] _burroughs_george  and he Is a little man -- I remember not the other Ministers Name I saw the Divel Open a Grate Booke & we all Sett or hands & Seales to it, the Ingagement was to afflict persons & over Come the Kingdome of Christ, & set up the Divels Kingdome & we ware to have hapy Days -- Marey Lacey S'd she heard them talk of throwing Dwone the Kingdome of Christ & Setting up the Divel on his throwne -- they ware to doe Soe throughout all the whole Country & were Enjoyned by the Divel to make as many Witches as we Could -- I know [Marthra Toothaker] _toothaker_mary  & her Mother to be witches & they ware in Company both times -- In Goeing to the Village Metting -- [Goody Lacey] _lacey_mary_sr  s'd all this was true [Rich'd] _carrier_richard  S'd that Toothak'r. that Dyed in prison was one too, [Mary lacey] _lacey_mary_jr  then in a bad fitt afflicted, this [Rich'd] _carrier_richard  Could then See Toothak'r Upon her --Q. [Rich'd] _carrier_richard  can you name any that ware at the mettings A. [Jno. Willard] _willard_john  [Jno. Procter] _proctor_john  & his Wife [Goody Nurse] _nurse_rebecca  . Goodman Gory & his wife. [Goody. how] _how_elizabeth  [Mrs Bradbery] _bradbury_mary  & [Goody Oliver] _bishop_bridget  &c. -- [Jno. Willard] _willard_john  Is a black hared Man of a Midle Statture & he told me his Name -- we heard a drum & [Mary Lacey] _lacey_mary_jr  heard the Same -- [Mary Lacey] _lacey_mary_jr  In a bad fitt [Rich'd] _carrier_richard  Sayd an kurse upon her & S'd. further that that man was at Salem Village Metting -- I was w'th [ballards wife] _balch_elizabeth  I Think I have afflicted 3 at the Village -- 2 in the Ministers house one of them a grown person the other a Child the growne person was the Mrs of the house, the Younger person was one [Abigail Williams] _williams_abigail  also [Mary Walkutt] _walcott_mary  on Wednesday last, I doe it by Roling up a handcherchif & Soe Imagining to be a representation of a person -- the Divel Doth it Some times the Divell Sturred Me Up to hurt the Ministers Wife -- I was Baptized at the falls at Newberry in the River he dipt my head into the Watt'r. but doe not Remember w't he S'd there were not above 7 Baptiz'd Viz [Mrs Brad'y] _bradbury_mary  [Goody Nurse] _nurse_rebecca  [Goody How] _how_elizabeth  -- When they Signed the book the Divel told them they Should over Come & Prevail the witches are all afaird they Shall al Come out & the Divel threatens if I come not Unto this Quarrell he will tear me in peaces --  After this [Rich'd] _carrier_richard  would take the afflicted persons by the hand w'th out hurting of them & asked forgiveness --( Essex Institute Collection, no. 24, 3r-4r, James Duncan Phillips Library, Peabody Essex Museum, Salem. )

case_title: SWP No. 025: Richard Carrier
title: (Examination of Richard Carrier )
content: SWP No. 25.3(Examination of [Richard Carrier] _carrier_richard  )[July 22, 1692][Richard Carriers:] _carrier_richard  Confession July 22: 1692Q. have you bin in the devils snare A: yes. Q. is yo'r bro: [Andrew] _carrier_andrew   ensnared by the devils snare: A Yes how long has yo'r brother bin   a witch: A: not long: Q. have you joined in aflicting the aflicted  persons: A: Yes: Q. you help't to hurt: [Timo: Swan:] _swan_timothy  did you A yes.  Q. how long: have you bin a wich: A abo't five weeks: who was in  Company when you Covnanted with the devill: A [Mrs Bradbery] _bradbury_mary   did she help you afflict: yes: what was the ocasion: [mrs Bradbery:] _bradbury_mary   would have to afflict [Timo. Swan:] _swan_timothy  A becaus: [her husband] _bradbury_thomas  & [Timo Swan] _swan_timothy  fell out about a scyth: I think: Q. did they not fall out about  thaching of a barn: to A no not as I know of Q. who was att the  Villadge meeting when you was there. A [goodwife How] _how_elizabeth  : [goodwife Nurs] _nurse_rebecca  [g wildes] _wilds_sarah  , Procter: & his wife [mrs Bradbery] _bradbury_mary  : & Gorys wife: Q:  was any of Boston there A no: Q how many was there in all: A: a  duzzen I think: was [Jno Willard] _willard_john  there A I think he was: Q. what kind  of man is [Jno willard:] _willard_john  a young man or an old man A he is not an old  man: he had black hair Q what meeting was this meeting: was this:  that: that was near: [Ingersals:] _ingersoll_nathaniel  A Yes I think Q. what did they do  then. A. the[y]: eat & they drank wine: was there: a minister. there A.  no: not as I know of: whence had you your wine: A. from Salem I think was from Q. [goodwife Olliver] _bishop_bridget  there: yes I knew her( Essex County Archives Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 2, No. 111 )

case_title: SWP No. 025: Richard Carrier
title: (Fragment of an Examination of Richard Carrier)
content: SWP No. 25.5(Fragment of an Examination of [Richard Carrier] _carrier_richard )[July 22, 1692]We met in a green, which was the minister's pasture - we were in two companies at last. I think there was a few men with them. - I heard [Sarah Good] _good_sarah  talk of a minister or two. One of them was she that had been at the eastward; his name is [Burroughs] _burroughs_george , and is a little man. -I remember not the other's name.William Frederick Poole. The Witchcraft Delusion of 1692. By Gov. Thomas Hutchinson, From an Unpublished Manuscript (An Early Draft of His History of Massachusetts) in the Massachusetts Archives. case_title: SWP No. 119: Margaret Scott Executed, September 22, 1692
title: ( Deposition of Frances Wycom v. Margaret Scott )
content: SWP No. 119.1( Deposition of [Frances Wycom] _wycom_frances  v. [Margaret Scott] _scott_margaret  )[September 15, 1692]The deposistion of [frances wycum] _wycom_frances  who testifieth and saith that quickly after the first court at Salme about wicthcraft [margerit Scott] _scott_margaret  whom I very well knew: or hir Apperance came to me and did most greviously torment me by choaking and almost presing me to death: and so she did continu affleting me by times tell the 5'th August 1692 being the day of hir examination allso during the time of hir Examination [margerit Scott] _scott_margaret  did most greviously  afflect me: and also severall times sence: and I beleve in my heart that [margerit Scott] _scott_margaret  is a wicth and that she has often affleted me by acts of wicthcraft[ffrances Wycom] _wycom_frances  owned: to the grand Inquest. that the above written evidence: is the truth upon oath: Sept'r 15, 1692:                       Jurat in Curia.(Reverse) [frances Wycomb] _wycom_frances  dep'oAgs't [#(M)Margaret Scott] _scott_margaret ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft vol. 2, no. 94, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archives, Boston, MA.  )

[Margaret Scott] _scott_margaret  )[September 15, 1692]also [phillip Nelson] _nelson_phillip  and [Sarah] _nelson_sarah  his wife doe testifie and say that for Two or three years before #(the said) [Robert Shilleto] _shilleton_robert  dyed we have often hard him complaining of [margerit Scott] _scott_margaret  for hurting of him and often said that she was a wicth and so he continewed complaining of [margerit Scott] _scott_margaret  saying he should never be well so long as [margerit Scott] _scott_margaret  lived & so he Complayned of [Margret Scott:] _scott_margaret  att times untill he dyed[Phillip Nelson] _nelson_phillip : and [Sarah] _nelson_sarah  his wife affirmed: upon their oath: to the grand Inquest that: the above written evidence: is the truth:Sept'r 15: 1692                              Jurat in Curia  (Reverse) [Sarah Nelson] _nelson_sarah  dep'oagst [Mary Scott] _scott_margaret  ( Essex County Court Archives, Salem -- Witchcraft Vol. 2, no. 95, Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court, Judicial Archives, Massachusetts State Archives, Boston, MA. )

case_title: SWP No. 119: Margaret Scott Executed, September 22, 1692
title: (Indictment of Margaret Scott, for Afflicting Frances Wycomb)
content: SWP No. 119.3(Indictment of [Margaret Scott] _scott_margaret , for Afflicting [Frances Wycomb] _wycom_frances )[+ September 15, 1692]Indicm't ag'st [Margaret Scott] _scott_margaret , for bewitching [Frances Wijcomb] _wycom_frances .Essex in the ProvinceAnno RR's & Reginae Gulielmiof the Massachusetts& Mariae &ca Quarto An-Bay in New Engl'dnoq; Domi 1692. ss.The Jurors for our Sov'e Lord and Lady the King and Queen doe Present That [Margarett Scott] _scott_margaret , of Rowley, In the County of Essex, Widdow: Upon the fifth day of August In the yeare aforesaid and divers other days and times as well before as after Certaine detesta- ble Arts Called Witchcraft and Sorceries Wickedly Mallitiously and felloniously hath used practised and Exercised At and in the towne of Salem in the County aforesaid in upon and against one [Frances Wijcomb] _wycom_frances , of Rowley, aforesaid Single Woman by which s'd Wicked Acts the said [Frances Wijcomb] _wycom_frances , the day and yea'e aforesaid and divers  other days and times both before and after was and is Tortured Afflicted Consumed Pined Wasted and Tor- mented, and also for sundry other Acts of Witchcraft by the said [Margaret Scott] _scott_margaret , Committed and done before and since that time against the Peace of our Sov'e Lord and Lady the King and Queen their Crowne and Dignity and the forme of the Stattute In that case made and Provided.Billa Vera.  Ponet Se.(Thomas Gage, The History of Rowley. (Boston: Ferdinand Andres, 1840) 169-170.

case_title: SWP No. 119: Margaret Scott Executed, September 22, 1692
title: (Deposition of Mary Daniel Vs. Margaret Scott & Elizabeth Jackson)
content: SWP No. 119.5(Deposition of [Mary Daniel] _daniel_mary  Vs. [Margaret Scott] _scott_margaret  & [Elizabeth Jackson] _jackson_elizabeth )[August 4, 1692]The Deposition of [Mary Daniel] _daniel_mary  aged nineteen yeers or there ab'ts s'd Deponent testifyeth that upon the 2'd day of the #(last) week last past, towards night, I was suddenly taken very ill and went to lye down on a bed, soon after which, there appeared to me the shape of some woman, who seemed to look and speak most feircly & angrily, and beat; pinch'd & afflicted me very sorely telling me I should not have said so, or told such things & to that purpose; I cannot positively say whose shape it was that I saw the first fitt. the next night after, I was taken very ill again all over & felt a great pricking in the soles of my feet, and after a while I saw apparently the shape of #(widow) [margret Scott] _scott_margaret , who, as I was sitting in a chair by the fire pulled me with the chair, down backward to the ground, and tormented and pinch'd me very much, and I saw her go away at the door, in which fit I was dumb and so continued till the next morning, finding a great load and heaviness upon my tongue. In some of the fitts that I had afterwards, I was sensless and knew not that I saw who it was that afflicted me. In one fitt (upon the beginning it) I thought I saw [goodw Jackson] _jackson_elizabeth  and [widow Scott] _scott_margaret  come waking into the chamber with y'r staves, one of them came and sat upon me so that I could not stirr; [Goodw Jackson] _jackson_elizabeth  I saw no more, nor know I that she did me any harm. In another fitt I saw the appearance of s'd [Scott] _scott_margaret  in the room who afflicted me, and being speechless, I continued so, untill I went to the s'd [Scott] _scott_margaret , who taking me by the hand, I had the liberty of speech again as formerly. The last fitt I had was upon the last Sabb'th day, in which I saw the shapes of four women or five, of whom [widow Scott] _scott_margaret  was one, the rest I knew not, nor knew that any did hurt me, unless s'd [widow Scott] _scott_margaret . Rowley August 4, 1692  [Mary Daniell] _daniel_mary  owned: the truth of the above written evidence #(upon as) to the Jury of Inquest Sept'r 15: 1692.M'r [Edward Paison] _payson_edward  Made Oath that [Mary Daniil] _daniel_mary  did declare as above is written. attest, [St: Sewall] _sewall_stephen  Cler in Court at Salem Sep'r 16. 92(Reverse) Mary Daniell dep'o Agst Mary Scott   (Thomas Gage. The History of Rowley. (Boston: Ferdinand Andres, 1840) 172-173.

case_title: SWP No. 119: Margaret Scott Executed, September 22, 1692
title: (Testimony of John Burbank and Daniel Wycomb Vs. Margaret Scott)
content: SWP No. 119.6(Testimony of [John Burbank] _burbank_john  and [Daniel Wycomb] _wycomb_daniel  Vs. [Margaret Scott] _scott_margaret )[September 15, 1692][Jno Burbanke] _burbank_john  De'po ag'st [Margret Scott] _scott_margaret . [Daniel Wycomb] _wycomb_daniel the testymony of [Daniell Wicom] _wycomb_daniel  ayged above fifty years Who sayth that abought five ore sixs years a go [Margret Scot] _scott_margaret  of Rowlah came to my hous and asked me if she might gleane corne in my felld i towld hir she might if she woulld stay whilst my corne was ought of the feeld s'd [Scot] _scott_margaret  s'd you will not get youer corne ought to night it may be i tould hir i would s'd [Scot] _scott_margaret  s'd may be not: at that,  time my wife gave s'd [Scot] _scott_margaret  sum corne and then [Scot] _scott_margaret  went a way and presently after s'd [Scot] _scott_margaret  was gon i went  with my cart and oxsen into the feeld for corne and when i had lodid my cart i went to go home with my corne but the oxsen would not draw the cart any ways bout from home thof i wear not twenty Rod from my Door and i coulld not get any corne ought of my felld that day the next Day i touck the same oxsen and put them to the cart and the s'd cart and the same lode of corne they did draw a way with ease. Jurat in Curia.Capt. [Dan'll Wycom] _wycomb_daniel  owned: the above written evi- dence to: be the truth before grand Inquest upon his oath [Jno: Burbank] _burbank_john  and [Frances Wycom] _wycom_frances , attested: to: sub- stance of this above written: evidence:: as: that: s'd [Scott] _scott_margaret  s'd: it may be you will not gett: yor corn in to night therefore let me glean to night: and that ye oxen would not goe forward: but backward with the load of corn: nor: the corn: could: none of it be gott in that night: be- fore: s'd Inquest: Sept'r: 15: 1692. Sworne in Court also by [John Burbanke] _burbank_john .(Thomas Gage, The History of Rowley. (Boston: Ferdinand Andres, 1840) 171-172.

case_title: SWP No. 119: Margaret Scott Executed, September 22, 1692
title: (Deposition of Thomas Nelson Vs. Margaret Scott)
content: SWP No. 119.8(Deposition of [Thomas Nelson] _nelson_thomas  Vs. [Margaret Scott] _scott_margaret )[September 15, 1692]The Deposition of [Thomas Nelson] _nelson_thomas , who saith, that, about six yeares ago the last winter, [Margaret Scot] _scott_margaret , of Rowley, widow, desired me to bring her some wood, and spake to me severall times for wood, and I told her, that I owed her ten shillings and I would bring her wood for it, and she was not willing to set of that. Earnest she was for me to bring her wood: denied her; soon after this one of my cattell was dead in the stantiall, and stood up on his hind feet, and kneeled on his knees afore, and little after this another of my cattell was ded in the yard, his neck under a plank at the barn side as if he were chok'd; and after this, and ever since, had hard thoughts of this woman and my neighbours told me, something more then ordinery that my cattell died so. And I do verily believe that she is a witch. [Tho: Nelson] _nelson_thomas , one of the Grand Inquest gave in this Evidence to the grant Inquest, September 15, 1692.                                                                                            Jurat in Curia.(Thomas Gage, The History of Rowley. (Boston: Ferdinand Andres, 1840), p. 174.
